2471/* Support functions for filenames in read and write
2472 - allows for gzipped files
2473*/
2474
2475
2476/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2477/*! simple check for file existence
2478
2479 \return 1 on existence, 0 otherwise
2480*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2481int nifti_fileexists(const char* fname)
2482{
2483 znzFile fp;
2484 fp = znzopen( fname , "rb" , 1 ) ;
2485 if( !znz_isnull(fp)((fp) == ((void*)0)) ) { znzclose(fp)Xznzclose(&(fp)); return 1; }
2486 return 0; /* fp is NULL */
2487}
2488
2489/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2490/*! return whether the filename is valid
2491
2492 Note: uppercase extensions are now valid. 27 Apr 2009 [rickr]
2493
2494 The name is considered valid if the file basename has length greater than
2495 zero, AND one of the valid nifti extensions is provided.
2496 fname input | return |
2497 ===============================
2498 "myimage" | 0 |
2499 "myimage.tif" | 0 |
2500 "myimage.tif.gz" | 0 |
2501 "myimage.nii" | 1 |
2502 ".nii" | 0 |
2503 ".myhiddenimage" | 0 |
2504 ".myhiddenimage.nii" | 1 |
2505*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2506int nifti_is_complete_filename(const char* fname)
2507{
2508 char * ext;
2509
2510 /* check input file(s) for sanity */
2511 if( fname == NULL((void*)0) || *fname == '\0' ){
2512 if ( g_opts.debug > 1 )
2513 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-- empty filename in nifti_validfilename()\n");
2514 return 0;
2515 }
2516
2517 ext = nifti_find_file_extension(fname);
2518 if ( ext == NULL((void*)0) ) { /*Invalid extension given */
2519 if ( g_opts.debug > 0 )
2520 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-- no nifti valid extension for filename '%s'\n", fname);
2521 return 0;
2522 }
2523
2524 if ( ext && ext == fname ) { /* then no filename prefix */
2525 if ( g_opts.debug > 0 )
2526 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-- no prefix for filename '%s'\n", fname);
2527 return 0;
2528 }
2529 return 1;
2530}
2531
2532/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2533/*! return whether the filename is valid
2534
2535 Allow uppercase extensions as valid. 27 Apr 2009 [rickr]
2536 Any .gz extension case must match the base extension case.
2537
2538 The name is considered valid if its length is positive, excluding
2539 any nifti filename extension.
2540 fname input | return | result of nifti_makebasename
2541 ====================================================================
2542 "myimage" | 1 | "myimage"
2543 "myimage.tif" | 1 | "myimage.tif"
2544 "myimage.tif.gz" | 1 | "myimage.tif"
2545 "myimage.nii" | 1 | "myimage"
2546 ".nii" | 0 | <ERROR - basename has zero length>
2547 ".myhiddenimage" | 1 | ".myhiddenimage"
2548 ".myhiddenimage.nii | 1 | ".myhiddenimage"
2549*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2550int nifti_validfilename(const char* fname)
2551{
2552 char * ext;
2553
2554 /* check input file(s) for sanity */
2555 if( fname == NULL((void*)0) || *fname == '\0' ){
2556 if ( g_opts.debug > 1 )
2557 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-- empty filename in nifti_validfilename()\n");
2558 return 0;
2559 }
2560
2561 ext = nifti_find_file_extension(fname);
2562
2563 if ( ext && ext == fname ) { /* then no filename prefix */
2564 if ( g_opts.debug > 0 )
2565 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-- no prefix for filename '%s'\n", fname);
2566 return 0;
2567 }
2568
2569 return 1;
2570}
2571
2572/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2573/*! check the end of the filename for a valid nifti extension
2574
2575 Valid extensions are currently .nii, .hdr, .img, .nia,
2576 or any of them followed by .gz. Note that '.' is part of
2577 the extension.
2578
2579 Uppercase extensions are also valid, but not mixed case.
2580
2581 \return a pointer to the extension (within the filename), or NULL
2582*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2583char * nifti_find_file_extension( const char * name )
2584{
2585 char * ext, extcopy[8];
2586 int len;
2587 char extnii[8] = ".nii"; /* modifiable, for possible uppercase */
2588 char exthdr[8] = ".hdr"; /* (leave space for .gz) */
2589 char extimg[8] = ".img";
2590 char extnia[8] = ".nia";
2591 char extgz[4] = ".gz";
2592 char * elist[4] = { NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0), NULL((void*)0)};
2593
2594 /* stupid compiler... */
2595 elist[0] = extnii; elist[1] = exthdr; elist[2] = extimg; elist[3] = extnia;
2596
2597 if ( ! name ) return NULL((void*)0);
2598
2599 len = (int)strlen(name);
2600 if ( len < 4 ) return NULL((void*)0);
2601
2602 ext = (char *)name + len - 4;
2603
2604 /* make manipulation copy, and possibly convert to lowercase */
2605 strcpy(extcopy, ext);
2606 if( g_opts.allow_upper_fext ) make_lowercase(extcopy);
2607
2608 /* if it look like a basic extension, fail or return it */
2609 if( compare_strlist(extcopy, elist, 4) >= 0 ) {
2610 if( is_mixedcase(ext) ) {
2611 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** mixed case extension '%s' is not valid\n", ext);
2612 return NULL((void*)0);
2613 }
2614 else return ext;
2615 }
2616
2617#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB1
2618 if ( len < 7 ) return NULL((void*)0);
2619
2620 ext = (char *)name + len - 7;
2621
2622 /* make manipulation copy, and possibly convert to lowercase */
2623 strcpy(extcopy, ext);
2624 if( g_opts.allow_upper_fext ) make_lowercase(extcopy);
2625
2626 /* go after .gz extensions using the modifiable strings */
2627 strcat(elist[0], extgz); strcat(elist[1], extgz); strcat(elist[2], extgz);
2628
2629 if( compare_strlist(extcopy, elist, 3) >= 0 ) {
2630 if( is_mixedcase(ext) ) {
2631 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** mixed case extension '%s' is not valid\n", ext);
2632 return NULL((void*)0);
2633 }
2634 else return ext;
2635 }
2636
2637#endif
2638
2639 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
2640 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** find_file_ext: failed for name '%s'\n", name);
2641
2642 return NULL((void*)0);
2643}
2644
2645/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2646/*! return whether the filename ends in ".gz"
2647*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2648int nifti_is_gzfile(const char* fname)
2649{
2650 /* return true if the filename ends with .gz */
2651 if (fname == NULL((void*)0)) { return 0; }
2652#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB1
2653 { /* just so len doesn't generate compile warning */
2654 int len;
2655 len = (int)strlen(fname);
2656 if (len < 3) return 0; /* so we don't search before the name */
2657 if (fileext_compare(fname + strlen(fname) - 3,".gz")==0) { return 1; }
2658 }
2659#endif
2660 return 0;
2661}
2662
2663/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2664/*! return whether the given library was compiled with HAVE_ZLIB set
2665*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2666int nifti_compiled_with_zlib(void)
2667{
2668#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB1
2669 return 1;
2670#else
2671 return 0;
2672#endif
2673}
2674
2675/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2676/*! duplicate the filename, while clearing any extension
2677
2678 This allocates memory for basename which should eventually be freed.
2679*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2680char * nifti_makebasename(const char* fname)
2681{
2682 char *basename, *ext;
2683
2684 basename=nifti_strdup(fname);
2685
2686 ext = nifti_find_file_extension(basename);
2687 if ( ext ) *ext = '\0'; /* clear out extension */
2688
2689 return basename; /* in either case */
2690}
2691
2692/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2693/*! set nifti's global debug level, for status reporting
2694
2695 - 0 : quiet, nothing is printed to the terminal, but errors
2696 - 1 : normal execution (the default)
2697 - 2, 3 : more details
2698*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2699void nifti_set_debug_level( int level )
2700{
2701 g_opts.debug = level;
2702}
2703
2704/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2705/*! set nifti's global skip_blank_ext flag 5 Sep 2006 [rickr]
2706
2707 explicitly set to 0 or 1
2708*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2709void nifti_set_skip_blank_ext( int skip )
2710{
2711 g_opts.skip_blank_ext = skip ? 1 : 0;
2712}
2713
2714/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2715/*! set nifti's global allow_upper_fext flag 28 Apr 2009 [rickr]
2716
2717 explicitly set to 0 or 1
2718*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2719void nifti_set_allow_upper_fext( int allow )
2720{
2721 g_opts.allow_upper_fext = allow ? 1 : 0;
2722}
2723
2724/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2725/*! check current directory for existing header file
2726
2727 \return filename of header on success and NULL if no appropriate file
2728 could be found
2729
2730 If fname has an uppercase extension, check for uppercase files.
2731
2732 NB: it allocates memory for hdrname which should be freed
2733 when no longer required
2734*//*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2735char * nifti_findhdrname(const char* fname)
2736{
2737 char *basename, *hdrname, *ext;
2738 char elist[2][5] = { ".hdr", ".nii" };
2739 char extzip[4] = ".gz";
2740 int efirst = 1; /* init to .nii extension */
2741 int eisupper = 0; /* init to lowercase extensions */
2742
2743 /**- check input file(s) for sanity */
2744 if( !nifti_validfilename(fname) ) return NULL((void*)0);
2745
2746 basename = nifti_makebasename(fname);
2747 if( !basename ) return NULL((void*)0); /* only on string alloc failure */
2748
2749 /**- return filename if it has a valid extension and exists
2750 (except if it is an .img file (and maybe .gz)) */
2751 ext = nifti_find_file_extension(fname);
2752
2753 if( ext ) eisupper = is_uppercase(ext); /* do we look for uppercase? */
2754
2755 /* if the file exists and is a valid header name (not .img), return it */
2756 if ( ext && nifti_fileexists(fname) ) {
2757 /* allow for uppercase extension */
2758 if ( fileext_n_compare(ext,".img",4) != 0 ){
2759 hdrname = nifti_strdup(fname);
2760 free(basename);
2761 return hdrname;
2762 } else
2763 efirst = 0; /* note for below */
2764 }
2765
2766 /* So the requested name is a basename, contains .img, or does not exist. */
2767 /* In any case, use basename. */
2768
2769 /**- if .img, look for .hdr, .hdr.gz, .nii, .nii.gz, in that order */
2770 /**- else, look for .nii, .nii.gz, .hdr, .hdr.gz, in that order */
2771
2772 /* if we get more extension choices, this could be a loop */
2773
2774 /* note: efirst is 0 in the case of ".img" */
2775
2776 /* if the user passed an uppercase entension (.IMG), search for uppercase */
2777 if( eisupper ) {
2778 make_uppercase(elist[0]);
2779 make_uppercase(elist[1]);
2780 make_uppercase(extzip);
2781 }
2782
2783 hdrname = (char *)calloc(sizeof(char),strlen(basename)+8);
2784 if( !hdrname ){
2785 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** nifti_findhdrname: failed to alloc hdrname\n");
2786 free(basename);
2787 return NULL((void*)0);
2788 }
2789
2790 strcpy(hdrname,basename);
2791 strcat(hdrname,elist[efirst]);
2792 if (nifti_fileexists(hdrname)) { free(basename); return hdrname; }
2793#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB1
2794 strcat(hdrname,extzip);
2795 if (nifti_fileexists(hdrname)) { free(basename); return hdrname; }
2796#endif
2797
2798 /* okay, try the other possibility */
2799
2800 efirst = 1 - efirst;
2801
2802 strcpy(hdrname,basename);
2803 strcat(hdrname,elist[efirst]);
2804 if (nifti_fileexists(hdrname)) { free(basename); return hdrname; }
2805#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB1
2806 strcat(hdrname,extzip);
2807 if (nifti_fileexists(hdrname)) { free(basename); return hdrname; }
2808#endif
2809
2810 /**- if nothing has been found, return NULL */
2811 free(basename);
2812 free(hdrname);
2813 return NULL((void*)0);
2814}
2815
2816
2817/*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2818/*! check current directory for existing image file
2819
2820 \param fname filename to check for
2821 \nifti_type nifti_type for dataset - this determines whether to
2822 first check for ".nii" or ".img" (since both may exist)
2823
2824 \return filename of data/img file on success and NULL if no appropriate
2825 file could be found
2826
2827 If fname has a valid, uppercase extension, apply all extensions as
2828 uppercase.
2829
2830 NB: it allocates memory for the image filename, which should be freed
2831 when no longer required
2832*//*---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2833char * nifti_findimgname(const char* fname , int nifti_type)
2834{
2835 /* store all extensions as strings, in case we need to go uppercase */
2836 char *basename, *imgname, elist[2][5] = { ".nii", ".img" };
2837 char extzip[4] = ".gz";
2838 char extnia[5] = ".nia";
2839 char *ext;
2840 int first; /* first extension to use */
2841
2842 /* check input file(s) for sanity */
2843 if( !nifti_validfilename(fname) ) return NULL((void*)0);
2844
2845 basename = nifti_makebasename(fname);
2846 imgname = (char *)calloc(sizeof(char),strlen(basename)+8);
2847 if( !imgname ){
2848 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** nifti_findimgname: failed to alloc imgname\n");
2849 free(basename);
2850 return NULL((void*)0);
2851 }
2852
2853 /* if we are looking for uppercase, apply the fact now */
2854 ext = nifti_find_file_extension(fname);
2855 if( ext && is_uppercase(ext) ) {
2856 make_uppercase(elist[0]);
2857 make_uppercase(elist[1]);
2858 make_uppercase(extzip);
2859 make_uppercase(extnia);
2860 }
2861
2862 /* only valid extension for ASCII type is .nia, handle first */
2863 if( nifti_type == NIFTI_FTYPE_ASCII3 ){
2864 strcpy(imgname,basename);
2865 strcat(imgname,extnia);
2866 if (nifti_fileexists(imgname)) { free(basename); return imgname; }
2867
2868 } else {
2869
2870 /**- test for .nii and .img (don't assume input type from image type) */
2871 /**- if nifti_type = 1, check for .nii first, else .img first */
2872
2873 /* if we get 3 or more extensions, can make a loop here... */
2874
2875 if (nifti_type == NIFTI_FTYPE_NIFTI1_11) first = 0; /* should match .nii */
2876 else first = 1; /* should match .img */
2877
2878 strcpy(imgname,basename);
2879 strcat(imgname,elist[first]);
2880 if (nifti_fileexists(imgname)) { free(basename); return imgname; }
2881#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB1 /* then also check for .gz */
2882 strcat(imgname,extzip);
2883 if (nifti_fileexists(imgname)) { free(basename); return imgname; }
2884#endif
2885
2886 /* failed to find image file with expected extension, try the other */
2887
2888 strcpy(imgname,basename);
2889 strcat(imgname,elist[1-first]); /* can do this with only 2 choices */
2890 if (nifti_fileexists(imgname)) { free(basename); return imgname; }
2891#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB1 /* then also check for .gz */
2892 strcat(imgname,extzip);
2893 if (nifti_fileexists(imgname)) { free(basename); return imgname; }
2894#endif
2895 }
2896
2897 /**- if nothing has been found, return NULL */
2898 free(basename);
2899 free(imgname);
2900 return NULL((void*)0);
2901}
2902
2903
2904/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2905/*! creates a filename for storing the header, based on nifti_type
2906
2907 \param prefix - this will be copied before the suffix is added
2908 \param nifti_type - determines the extension, unless one is in prefix
2909 \param check - check for existence (fail condition)
2910 \param comp - add .gz for compressed name
2911
2912 Note that if prefix provides a file suffix, nifti_type is not used.
2913
2914 NB: this allocates memory which should be freed
2915
2916 \sa nifti_set_filenames
2917*//*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2918char * nifti_makehdrname(const char * prefix, int nifti_type, int check,
2919 int comp)
2920{
2921 char * iname, * ext;
2922 char extnii[5] = ".nii"; /* modifiable, for possible uppercase */
2923 char exthdr[5] = ".hdr";
2924 char extimg[5] = ".img";
2925 char extnia[5] = ".nia";
2926 char extgz[5] = ".gz";
2927
2928 if( !nifti_validfilename(prefix) ) return NULL((void*)0);
2929
2930 /* add space for extension, optional ".gz", and null char */
2931 iname = (char *)calloc(sizeof(char),strlen(prefix)+8);
2932 if( !iname ){ fprintf(stderrstderr,"** small malloc failure!\n"); return NULL((void*)0); }
2933 strcpy(iname, prefix);
2934
2935 /* use any valid extension */
2936 if( (ext = nifti_find_file_extension(iname)) != NULL((void*)0) ){
2937 /* if uppercase, convert all extensions */
2938 if( is_uppercase(ext) ) {
2939 make_uppercase(extnii);
2940 make_uppercase(exthdr);
2941 make_uppercase(extimg);
2942 make_uppercase(extnia);
2943 make_uppercase(extgz);
2944 }
2945
2946 if( strncmp(ext,extimg,4) == 0 )
2947 memcpy(ext,exthdr,4); /* then convert img name to hdr */
2948 }
2949 /* otherwise, make one up */
2950 else if( nifti_type == NIFTI_FTYPE_NIFTI1_11 ) strcat(iname, extnii);
2951 else if( nifti_type == NIFTI_FTYPE_ASCII3 ) strcat(iname, extnia);
2952 else strcat(iname, exthdr);
2953
2954#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB1 /* if compression is requested, make sure of suffix */
2955 if( comp && (!ext || !strstr(iname,extgz)) ) strcat(iname,extgz);
2956#endif
2957
2958 /* check for existence failure */
2959 if( check && nifti_fileexists(iname) ){
2960 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** failure: header file '%s' already exists\n",iname);
2961 free(iname);
2962 return NULL((void*)0);
2963 }
2964
2965 if(g_opts.debug > 2) fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d made header filename '%s'\n", iname);
2966
2967 return iname;
2968}
2969
2970
2971/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2972/*! creates a filename for storing the image, based on nifti_type
2973
2974 \param prefix - this will be copied before the suffix is added
2975 \param nifti_type - determines the extension, unless provided by prefix
2976 \param check - check for existence (fail condition)
2977 \param comp - add .gz for compressed name
2978
2979 Note that if prefix provides a file suffix, nifti_type is not used.
2980
2981 NB: it allocates memory which should be freed
2982
2983 \sa nifti_set_filenames
2984*//*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2985char * nifti_makeimgname(const char * prefix, int nifti_type, int check,
2986 int comp)
2987{
2988 char * iname, * ext;
2989 char extnii[5] = ".nii"; /* modifiable, for possible uppercase */
2990 char exthdr[5] = ".hdr";
2991 char extimg[5] = ".img";
2992 char extnia[5] = ".nia";
2993 char extgz[5] = ".gz";
2994
2995 if( !nifti_validfilename(prefix) ) return NULL((void*)0);
2996
2997 /* add space for extension, optional ".gz", and null char */
2998 iname = (char *)calloc(sizeof(char),strlen(prefix)+8);
2999 if( !iname ){ fprintf(stderrstderr,"** small malloc failure!\n"); return NULL((void*)0); }
3000 strcpy(iname, prefix);
3001
3002 /* use any valid extension */
3003 if( (ext = nifti_find_file_extension(iname)) != NULL((void*)0) ){
3004 /* if uppercase, convert all extensions */
3005 if( is_uppercase(ext) ) {
3006 make_uppercase(extnii);
3007 make_uppercase(exthdr);
3008 make_uppercase(extimg);
3009 make_uppercase(extnia);
3010 make_uppercase(extgz);
3011 }
3012
3013 if( strncmp(ext,exthdr,4) == 0 )
3014 memcpy(ext,extimg,4); /* then convert hdr name to img */
3015 }
3016 /* otherwise, make one up */
3017 else if( nifti_type == NIFTI_FTYPE_NIFTI1_11 ) strcat(iname, extnii);
3018 else if( nifti_type == NIFTI_FTYPE_ASCII3 ) strcat(iname, extnia);
3019 else strcat(iname, extimg);
3020
3021#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB1 /* if compression is requested, make sure of suffix */
3022 if( comp && (!ext || !strstr(iname,extgz)) ) strcat(iname,extgz);
3023#endif
3024
3025 /* check for existence failure */
3026 if( check && nifti_fileexists(iname) ){
3027 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** failure: image file '%s' already exists\n",iname);
3028 free(iname);
3029 return NULL((void*)0);
3030 }
3031
3032 if( g_opts.debug > 2 ) fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d made image filename '%s'\n",iname);
3033
3034 return iname;
3035}
3036
3037
3038/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3039/*! create and set new filenames, based on prefix and image type
3040
3041 \param nim pointer to nifti_image in which to set filenames
3042 \param prefix (required) prefix for output filenames
3043 \param check check for previous existence of filename
3044 (existence is an error condition)
3045 \param set_byte_order flag to set nim->byteorder here
3046 (this is probably a logical place to do so)
3047
3048 \return 0 on successful update
3049
3050 \warning this will free() any existing names and create new ones
3051
3052 \sa nifti_makeimgname, nifti_makehdrname, nifti_type_and_names_match
3053*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3054int nifti_set_filenames( nifti_image * nim, const char * prefix, int check,
3055 int set_byte_order )
3056{
3057 int comp = nifti_is_gzfile(prefix);
3058
3059 if( !nim || !prefix ){
3060 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** nifti_set_filenames, bad params %p, %p\n",
3061 (void *)nim,prefix);
3062 return -1;
3063 }
3064
3065 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
3066 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d modifying output filenames using prefix %s\n", prefix);
3067
3068 if( nim->fname ) free(nim->fname);
3069 if( nim->iname ) free(nim->iname);
3070 nim->fname = nifti_makehdrname(prefix, nim->nifti_type, check, comp);
3071 nim->iname = nifti_makeimgname(prefix, nim->nifti_type, check, comp);
3072 if( !nim->fname || !nim->iname ){
3073 LNI_FERR("nifti_set_filename","failed to set prefix for",prefix)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n","nifti_set_filename"
,"failed to set prefix for",prefix);
3074 return -1;
3075 }
3076
3077 if( set_byte_order ) nim->byteorder = nifti_short_order() ;
3078
3079 if( nifti_set_type_from_names(nim) < 0 )
3080 return -1;
3081
3082 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
3083 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d have new filenames %s and %s\n",nim->fname,nim->iname);
3084
3085 return 0;
3086}
3087
3088
3089/*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3090/*! check whether nifti_type matches fname and iname for the nifti_image
3091
3092 - if type 0 or 2, expect .hdr/.img pair
3093 - if type 1, expect .nii (and names must match)
3094
3095 \param nim given nifti_image
3096 \param show_warn if set, print a warning message for any mis-match
3097
3098 \return
3099 - 1 if the values seem to match
3100 - 0 if there is a mis-match
3101 - -1 if there is not sufficient information to create file(s)
3102
3103 \sa NIFTI_FTYPE_* codes in nifti1_io.h
3104 \sa nifti_set_type_from_names, is_valid_nifti_type
3105*//*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3106int nifti_type_and_names_match( nifti_image * nim, int show_warn )
3107{
3108 char func[] = "nifti_type_and_names_match";
3109 char * ext_h, * ext_i; /* header and image filename extensions */
3110 int errs = 0; /* error counter */
3111
3112 /* sanity checks */
3113 if( !nim ){
3114 if( show_warn ) fprintf(stderrstderr,"** %s: missing nifti_image\n", func);
3115 return -1;
3116 }
3117 if( !nim->fname ){
3118 if( show_warn ) fprintf(stderrstderr,"** %s: missing header filename\n", func);
3119 errs++;
3120 }
3121 if( !nim->iname ){
3122 if( show_warn ) fprintf(stderrstderr,"** %s: missing image filename\n", func);
3123 errs++;
3124 }
3125 if( !is_valid_nifti_type(nim->nifti_type) ){
3126 if( show_warn )
3127 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** %s: bad nifti_type %d\n", func, nim->nifti_type);
3128 errs++;
3129 }
3130
3131 if( errs ) return -1; /* then do not proceed */
3132
3133 /* get pointers to extensions */
3134 ext_h = nifti_find_file_extension( nim->fname );
3135 ext_i = nifti_find_file_extension( nim->iname );
3136
3137 /* check for filename extensions */
3138 if( !ext_h ){
3139 if( show_warn )
3140 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d missing NIFTI extension in header filename, %s\n",
3141 nim->fname);
3142 errs++;
3143 }
3144 if( !ext_i ){
3145 if( show_warn )
3146 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d missing NIFTI extension in image filename, %s\n",
3147 nim->iname);
3148 errs++;
3149 }
3150
3151 if( errs ) return 0; /* do not proceed, but this is just a mis-match */
3152
3153 /* general tests */
3154 if( nim->nifti_type == NIFTI_FTYPE_NIFTI1_11 ){ /* .nii */
3155 if( fileext_n_compare(ext_h,".nii",4) ) {
3156 if( show_warn )
3157 fprintf(stderrstderr,
3158 "-d NIFTI_FTYPE 1, but no .nii extension in header filename, %s\n",
3159 nim->fname);
3160 errs++;
3161 }
3162 if( fileext_n_compare(ext_i,".nii",4) ) {
3163 if( show_warn )
3164 fprintf(stderrstderr,
3165 "-d NIFTI_FTYPE 1, but no .nii extension in image filename, %s\n",
3166 nim->iname);
3167 errs++;
3168 }
3169 if( strcmp(nim->fname, nim->iname) != 0 ){
3170 if( show_warn )
3171 fprintf(stderrstderr,
3172 "-d NIFTI_FTYPE 1, but header and image filenames differ: %s, %s\n",
3173 nim->fname, nim->iname);
3174 errs++;
3175 }
3176 }
3177 else if( (nim->nifti_type == NIFTI_FTYPE_NIFTI1_22) || /* .hdr/.img */
3178 (nim->nifti_type == NIFTI_FTYPE_ANALYZE0) )
3179 {
3180 if( fileext_n_compare(ext_h,".hdr",4) != 0 ){
3181 if( show_warn )
3182 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d no '.hdr' extension, but NIFTI type is %d, %s\n",
3183 nim->nifti_type, nim->fname);
3184 errs++;
3185 }
3186 if( fileext_n_compare(ext_i,".img",4) != 0 ){
3187 if( show_warn )
3188 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d no '.img' extension, but NIFTI type is %d, %s\n",
3189 nim->nifti_type, nim->iname);
3190 errs++;
3191 }
3192 }
3193 /* ignore any other nifti_type */
3194
3195 return 1;
3196}
3197
3198/* like strcmp, but also check against capitalization of known_ext
3199 * (test as local string, with max length 7) */
3200static int fileext_compare(const char * test_ext, const char * known_ext)
3201{
3202 char caps[16] = "";
3203 int c, cmp, len;
3204
3205 /* if equal, don't need to check case (store to avoid multiple calls) */
3206 cmp = strcmp(test_ext, known_ext);
3207 if( cmp == 0 ) return cmp;
3208
3209 /* if anything odd, use default */
3210 if( !test_ext || !known_ext ) return cmp;
3211
3212 len = strlen(known_ext);
3213 if( len > 7 ) return cmp;
3214
3215 /* if here, strings are different but need to check upper-case */
3216
3217 for(c = 0; c < len; c++ ) caps[c] = toupper(known_ext[c]);
3218 caps[c] = '\0';
3219
3220 return strcmp(test_ext, caps);
3221}
3222
3223/* like strncmp, but also check against capitalization of known_ext
3224 * (test as local string, with max length 7) */
3225static int fileext_n_compare(const char * test_ext,
3226 const char * known_ext, int maxlen)
3227{
3228 char caps[16] = "";
3229 int c, cmp, len;
3230
3231 /* if equal, don't need to check case (store to avoid multiple calls) */
3232 cmp = strncmp(test_ext, known_ext, maxlen);
3233 if( cmp == 0 ) return cmp;
3234
3235 /* if anything odd, use default */
3236 if( !test_ext || !known_ext ) return cmp;
3237
3238 len = strlen(known_ext);
3239 if( len > maxlen ) len = maxlen; /* ignore anything past maxlen */
3240 if( len > 7 ) return cmp;
3241
3242 /* if here, strings are different but need to check upper-case */
3243
3244 for(c = 0; c < len; c++ ) caps[c] = toupper(known_ext[c]);
3245 caps[c] = '\0';
3246
3247 return strncmp(test_ext, caps, maxlen);
3248}
3249
3250/* return 1 if there are uppercase but no lowercase */
3251static int is_uppercase(const char * str)
3252{
3253 int c, hasupper = 0;
3254
3255 if( !str || !*str ) return 0;
3256
3257 for(c = 0; c < strlen(str); c++ ) {
3258 if( islower(str[c])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((str[c]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISlower) ) return 0;
3259 if( !hasupper && isupper(str[c])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((str[c]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISupper) ) hasupper = 1;
3260 }
3261
3262 return hasupper;
3263}
3264
3265/* return 1 if there are both uppercase and lowercase characters */
3266static int is_mixedcase(const char * str)
3267{
3268 int c, hasupper = 0, haslower = 0;
3269
3270 if( !str || !*str ) return 0;
3271
3272 for(c = 0; c < strlen(str); c++ ) {
3273 if( !haslower && islower(str[c])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((str[c]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISlower) ) haslower = 1;
3274 if( !hasupper && isupper(str[c])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((str[c]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISupper) ) hasupper = 1;
3275
3276 if( haslower && hasupper ) return 1;
3277 }
3278
3279 return 0;
3280}
3281
3282/* convert any lowercase chars to uppercase */
3283static int make_uppercase(char * str)
3284{
3285 int c;
3286
3287 if( !str || !*str ) return 0;
3288
3289 for(c = 0; c < strlen(str); c++ )
3290 if( islower(str[c])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((str[c]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISlower) ) str[c] = toupper(str[c]);
3291
3292 return 0;
3293}
3294
3295/* convert any uppercase chars to lowercase */
3296static int make_lowercase(char * str)
3297{
3298 int c;
3299
3300 if( !str || !*str ) return 0;
3301
3302 for(c = 0; c < strlen(str); c++ )
3303 if( isupper(str[c])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) ((str[c]))] & (unsigned short int
) _ISupper) ) str[c] = tolower(str[c]);
3304
3305 return 0;
3306}
3307
3308/* run strcmp against of list of strings
3309 * return index of equality, if found
3310 * else return -1 */
3311static int compare_strlist(const char * str, char ** strlist, int len)
3312{
3313 int c;
3314 if( len <= 0 || !str || !strlist ) return -1;
3315 for( c = 0; c < len; c++ )
3316 if( strlist[c] && !strcmp(str, strlist[c]) ) return c;
3317 return -1;
3318}
3319
3320/*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3321/*! check whether the given type is on the "approved" list
3322
3323 The code is valid if it is non-negative, and does not exceed
3324 NIFTI_MAX_FTYPE.
3325
3326 \return 1 if nifti_type is valid, 0 otherwise
3327 \sa NIFTI_FTYPE_* codes in nifti1_io.h
3328*//*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3329int is_valid_nifti_type( int nifti_type )
3330{
3331 if( nifti_type >= NIFTI_FTYPE_ANALYZE0 && /* smallest type, 0 */
3332 nifti_type <= NIFTI_MAX_FTYPE3 )
3333 return 1;
3334 return 0;
3335}
3336
3337
3338/*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3339/*! check whether the given type is on the "approved" list
3340
3341 The type is explicitly checked against the NIFTI_TYPE_* list
3342 in nifti1.h.
3343
3344 \return 1 if dtype is valid, 0 otherwise
3345 \sa NIFTI_TYPE_* codes in nifti1.h
3346*//*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3347int nifti_is_valid_datatype( int dtype )
3348{
3349 if( dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_UINT82 ||
3350 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_INT164 ||
3351 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_INT328 ||
3352 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_FLOAT3216 ||
3353 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_COMPLEX6432 ||
3354 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_FLOAT6464 ||
3355 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_RGB24128 ||
3356 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_RGBA322304 ||
3357 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_INT8256 ||
3358 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_UINT16512 ||
3359 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_UINT32768 ||
3360 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_INT641024 ||
3361 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_UINT641280 ||
3362 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_FLOAT1281536 ||
3363 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_COMPLEX1281792 ||
3364 dtype == NIFTI_TYPE_COMPLEX2562048 ) return 1;
3365 return 0;
3366}
3367
3368
3369/*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3370/*! set the nifti_type field based on fname and iname
3371
3372 Note that nifti_type is changed only when it does not match
3373 the filenames.
3374
3375 \return 0 on success, -1 on error
3376
3377 \sa is_valid_nifti_type, nifti_type_and_names_match
3378*//*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3379int nifti_set_type_from_names( nifti_image * nim )
3380{
3381 /* error checking first */
3382 if( !nim ){ fprintf(stderrstderr,"** NSTFN: no nifti_image\n"); return -1; }
3383
3384 if( !nim->fname || !nim->iname ){
3385 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** NSTFN: missing filename(s) fname @ %p, iname @ %p\n",
3386 nim->fname, nim->iname);
3387 return -1;
3388 }
3389
3390 if( ! nifti_validfilename ( nim->fname ) ||
3391 ! nifti_validfilename ( nim->iname ) ||
3392 ! nifti_find_file_extension( nim->fname ) ||
3393 ! nifti_find_file_extension( nim->iname )
3394 ) {
3395 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** NSTFN: invalid filename(s) fname='%s', iname='%s'\n",
3396 nim->fname, nim->iname);
3397 return -1;
3398 }
3399
3400 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
3401 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d verify nifti_type from filenames: %d",nim->nifti_type);
3402
3403 /* type should be NIFTI_FTYPE_ASCII if extension is .nia */
3404 if( (fileext_compare(nifti_find_file_extension(nim->fname),".nia")==0)){
3405 nim->nifti_type = NIFTI_FTYPE_ASCII3;
3406 } else {
3407 /* not too picky here, do what must be done, and then verify */
3408 if( strcmp(nim->fname, nim->iname) == 0 ) /* one file, type 1 */
3409 nim->nifti_type = NIFTI_FTYPE_NIFTI1_11;
3410 else if( nim->nifti_type == NIFTI_FTYPE_NIFTI1_11 ) /* cannot be type 1 */
3411 nim->nifti_type = NIFTI_FTYPE_NIFTI1_22;
3412 }
3413
3414 if( g_opts.debug > 2 ) fprintf(stderrstderr," -> %d\n",nim->nifti_type);
3415
3416 if( g_opts.debug > 1 ) /* warn user about anything strange */
3417 nifti_type_and_names_match(nim, 1);
3418
3419 if( is_valid_nifti_type(nim->nifti_type) ) return 0; /* success! */
3420
3421 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** NSTFN: bad nifti_type %d, for '%s' and '%s'\n",
3422 nim->nifti_type, nim->fname, nim->iname);
3423
3424 return -1;
3425}
3426
3427
3428/*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3429/*! Determine if this is a NIFTI-formatted file.
3430
3431 <pre>
3432 \return 0 if file looks like ANALYZE 7.5 [checks sizeof_hdr field == 348]
3433 1 if file marked as NIFTI (header+data in 1 file)
3434 2 if file marked as NIFTI (header+data in 2 files)
3435 -1 if it can't tell, file doesn't exist, etc.
3436 </pre>
3437*//*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3438int is_nifti_file( const char *hname )
3439{
3440 struct nifti_1_header nhdr ;
3441 znzFile fp ;
3442 int ii ;
3443 char *tmpname;
3444
3445 /* bad input name? */
3446
3447 if( !nifti_validfilename(hname) ) return -1 ;
3448
3449 /* open file */
3450
3451 tmpname = nifti_findhdrname(hname);
3452 if( tmpname == NULL((void*)0) ){
3453 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
3454 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** no header file found for '%s'\n",hname);
3455 return -1;
3456 }
3457 fp = znzopen( tmpname , "rb" , nifti_is_gzfile(tmpname) ) ;
3458 free(tmpname);
3459 if (znz_isnull(fp)((fp) == ((void*)0))) return -1 ; /* bad open? */
3460
3461 /* read header, close file */
3462
3463 ii = (int)znzread( &nhdr , 1 , sizeof(nhdr) , fp ) ;
3464 znzclose( fp )Xznzclose(&(fp)) ;
3465 if( ii < (int) sizeof(nhdr) ) return -1 ; /* bad read? */
3466
3467 /* check for NIFTI-ness */
3468
3469 if( NIFTI_VERSION(nhdr)( ( (nhdr).magic[0]=='n' && (nhdr).magic[3]=='\0' &&
( (nhdr).magic[1]=='i' || (nhdr).magic[1]=='+' ) && (
(nhdr).magic[2]>='1' && (nhdr).magic[2]<='9' )
) ? (nhdr).magic[2]-'0' : 0 ) != 0 ){
3470 return ( NIFTI_ONEFILE(nhdr)( (nhdr).magic[1] == '+' ) ) ? 1 : 2 ;
3471 }
3472
3473 /* check for ANALYZE-ness (sizeof_hdr field == 348) */
3474
3475 ii = nhdr.sizeof_hdr ;
3476 if( ii == (int)sizeof(nhdr) ) return 0 ; /* matches */
3477
3478 /* try byte-swapping header */
3479
3480 swap_4(ii)nifti_swap_4bytes(1,&(ii)) ;
3481 if( ii == (int)sizeof(nhdr) ) return 0 ; /* matches */
3482
3483 return -1 ; /* not good */
3484}
3485
3486static int print_hex_vals( const char * data, int nbytes, FILE * fp )
3487{
3488 int c;
3489
3490 if ( !data || nbytes < 1 || !fp ) return -1;
3491
3492 fputs("0x", fp);
3493 for ( c = 0; c < nbytes; c++ )
3494 fprintf(fp, " %x", data[c]);
3495
3496 return 0;
3497}
3498
3499/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3500/*! display the contents of the nifti_1_header (send to stdout)
3501
3502 \param info if non-NULL, print this character string
3503 \param hp pointer to nifti_1_header
3504*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3505int disp_nifti_1_header( const char * info, const nifti_1_header * hp )
3506{
3507 int c;
3508
3509 fputs( "-------------------------------------------------------\n", stdoutstdout );
3510 if ( info ) fputs( info, stdoutstdout );
3511 if ( !hp ){ fputs(" ** no nifti_1_header to display!\n",stdoutstdout); return 1; }
3512
3513 fprintf(stdoutstdout," nifti_1_header :\n"
3514 " sizeof_hdr = %d\n"
3515 " data_type[10] = ", hp->sizeof_hdr);
3516 print_hex_vals(hp->data_type, 10, stdoutstdout);
3517 fprintf(stdoutstdout, "\n"
3518 " db_name[18] = ");
3519 print_hex_vals(hp->db_name, 18, stdoutstdout);
3520 fprintf(stdoutstdout, "\n"
3521 " extents = %d\n"
3522 " session_error = %d\n"
3523 " regular = 0x%x\n"
3524 " dim_info = 0x%x\n",
3525 hp->extents, hp->session_error, hp->regular, hp->dim_info );
3526 fprintf(stdoutstdout, " dim[8] =");
3527 for ( c = 0; c < 8; c++ ) fprintf(stdoutstdout," %d", hp->dim[c]);
3528 fprintf(stdoutstdout, "\n"
3529 " intent_p1 = %f\n"
3530 " intent_p2 = %f\n"
3531 " intent_p3 = %f\n"
3532 " intent_code = %d\n"
3533 " datatype = %d\n"
3534 " bitpix = %d\n"
3535 " slice_start = %d\n"
3536 " pixdim[8] =",
3537 hp->intent_p1, hp->intent_p2, hp->intent_p3, hp->intent_code,
3538 hp->datatype, hp->bitpix, hp->slice_start);
3539 /* break pixdim over 2 lines */
3540 for ( c = 0; c < 4; c++ ) fprintf(stdoutstdout," %f", hp->pixdim[c]);
3541 fprintf(stdoutstdout, "\n ");
3542 for ( c = 4; c < 8; c++ ) fprintf(stdoutstdout," %f", hp->pixdim[c]);
3543 fprintf(stdoutstdout, "\n"
3544 " vox_offset = %f\n"
3545 " scl_slope = %f\n"
3546 " scl_inter = %f\n"
3547 " slice_end = %d\n"
3548 " slice_code = %d\n"
3549 " xyzt_units = 0x%x\n"
3550 " cal_max = %f\n"
3551 " cal_min = %f\n"
3552 " slice_duration = %f\n"
3553 " toffset = %f\n"
3554 " glmax = %d\n"
3555 " glmin = %d\n",
3556 hp->vox_offset, hp->scl_slope, hp->scl_inter, hp->slice_end,
3557 hp->slice_code, hp->xyzt_units, hp->cal_max, hp->cal_min,
3558 hp->slice_duration, hp->toffset, hp->glmax, hp->glmin);
3559 fprintf(stdoutstdout,
3560 " descrip = '%.80s'\n"
3561 " aux_file = '%.24s'\n"
3562 " qform_code = %d\n"
3563 " sform_code = %d\n"
3564 " quatern_b = %f\n"
3565 " quatern_c = %f\n"
3566 " quatern_d = %f\n"
3567 " qoffset_x = %f\n"
3568 " qoffset_y = %f\n"
3569 " qoffset_z = %f\n"
3570 " srow_x[4] = %f, %f, %f, %f\n"
3571 " srow_y[4] = %f, %f, %f, %f\n"
3572 " srow_z[4] = %f, %f, %f, %f\n"
3573 " intent_name = '%-.16s'\n"
3574 " magic = '%-.4s'\n",
3575 hp->descrip, hp->aux_file, hp->qform_code, hp->sform_code,
3576 hp->quatern_b, hp->quatern_c, hp->quatern_d,
3577 hp->qoffset_x, hp->qoffset_y, hp->qoffset_z,
3578 hp->srow_x[0], hp->srow_x[1], hp->srow_x[2], hp->srow_x[3],
3579 hp->srow_y[0], hp->srow_y[1], hp->srow_y[2], hp->srow_y[3],
3580 hp->srow_z[0], hp->srow_z[1], hp->srow_z[2], hp->srow_z[3],
3581 hp->intent_name, hp->magic);
3582 fputs( "-------------------------------------------------------\n", stdoutstdout );
3583 fflush(stdoutstdout);
3584
3585 return 0;
3586}
3587
3588
3589#undef ERREX
3590#define ERREX(msg)do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,(msg)) ; return fp ; } while(0) \
3591 do{ fprintf(stderrstderr,"** ERROR: nifti_convert_nhdr2nim: %s\n", (msg) ) ; \
3592 return NULL((void*)0) ; } while(0)
3593
3594/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3595/*! convert a nifti_1_header into a nift1_image
3596
3597 \return an allocated nifti_image, or NULL on failure
3598*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3599nifti_image* nifti_convert_nhdr2nim(struct nifti_1_header nhdr,
3600 const char * fname)
3601{
3602 int ii , doswap , ioff ;
3603 int is_nifti , is_onefile ;
3604 nifti_image *nim;
3605
3606 nim = (nifti_image *)calloc( 1 , sizeof(nifti_image) ) ;
3607 if( !nim ) ERREX("failed to allocate nifti image")do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,("failed to allocate nifti image")) ; return fp ; } while(0);
3608
3609 /* be explicit with pointers */
3610 nim->fname = NULL((void*)0);
3611 nim->iname = NULL((void*)0);
3612 nim->data = NULL((void*)0);
3613
3614 /**- check if we must swap bytes */
3615
3616 doswap = need_nhdr_swap(nhdr.dim[0], nhdr.sizeof_hdr); /* swap data flag */
3617
3618 if( doswap < 0 ){
3619 if( doswap == -1 ) ERREX("bad dim[0]")do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,("bad dim[0]")) ; return fp ; } while(0) ;
3620 ERREX("bad sizeof_hdr")do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,("bad sizeof_hdr")) ; return fp ; } while(0) ; /* else */
3621 }
3622
3623 /**- determine if this is a NIFTI-1 compliant header */
3624
3625 is_nifti = NIFTI_VERSION(nhdr)( ( (nhdr).magic[0]=='n' && (nhdr).magic[3]=='\0' &&
( (nhdr).magic[1]=='i' || (nhdr).magic[1]=='+' ) && (
(nhdr).magic[2]>='1' && (nhdr).magic[2]<='9' )
) ? (nhdr).magic[2]-'0' : 0 ) ;
3626 /*
3627 * before swapping header, record the Analyze75 orient code
3628 */
3629 if(!is_nifti)
3630 {
3631 /**- in analyze75, the orient code is at the same address as
3632 * qform_code, but it's just one byte
3633 * the qform_code will be zero, at which point you can check
3634 * analyze75_orient if you care to.
3635 */
3636 unsigned char c = *((char *)(&nhdr.qform_code));
3637 nim->analyze75_orient = (analyze_75_orient_code)c;
3638 }
3639 if( doswap ) {
3640 if ( g_opts.debug > 3 ) disp_nifti_1_header("-d ni1 pre-swap: ", &nhdr);
3641 swap_nifti_header( &nhdr , is_nifti ) ;
3642 }
3643
3644 if ( g_opts.debug > 2 ) disp_nifti_1_header("-d nhdr2nim : ", &nhdr);
3645
3646 if( nhdr.datatype == DT_BINARY1 ||
3647 nhdr.datatype == DT_UNKNOWN0 ) ERREX("bad datatype")do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,("bad datatype")) ; return fp ; } while(0) ;
3648
3649 if( nhdr.dim[1] <= 0 ) ERREX("bad dim[1]")do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,("bad dim[1]")) ; return fp ; } while(0) ;
3650
3651 /* fix bad dim[] values in the defined dimension range */
3652 for( ii=2 ; ii <= nhdr.dim[0] ; ii++ )
3653 if( nhdr.dim[ii] <= 0 ) nhdr.dim[ii] = 1 ;
3654
3655 /* fix any remaining bad dim[] values, so garbage does not propagate */
3656 /* (only values 0 or 1 seem rational, otherwise set to arbirary 1) */
3657 for( ii=nhdr.dim[0]+1 ; ii <= 7 ; ii++ )
3658 if( nhdr.dim[ii] != 1 && nhdr.dim[ii] != 0) nhdr.dim[ii] = 1 ;
3659
3660#if 0 /* rely on dim[0], do not attempt to modify it 16 Nov 2005 [rickr] */
3661
3662 /**- get number of dimensions (ignoring dim[0] now) */
3663 for( ii=7 ; ii >= 2 ; ii-- ) /* loop backwards until we */
3664 if( nhdr.dim[ii] > 1 ) break ; /* find a dim bigger than 1 */
3665 ndim = ii ;
3666#endif
3667
3668 /**- set bad grid spacings to 1.0 */
3669
3670 for( ii=1 ; ii <= nhdr.dim[0] ; ii++ )
3671 if( nhdr.pixdim[ii] == 0.0 )
3672 nhdr.pixdim[ii] = 1.0;
3673
3674 is_onefile = is_nifti && NIFTI_ONEFILE(nhdr)( (nhdr).magic[1] == '+' ) ;
3675
3676 if( is_nifti ) nim->nifti_type = (is_onefile) ? NIFTI_FTYPE_NIFTI1_11
3677 : NIFTI_FTYPE_NIFTI1_22 ;
3678 else nim->nifti_type = NIFTI_FTYPE_ANALYZE0 ;
3679
3680 ii = nifti_short_order() ;
3681 if( doswap ) nim->byteorder = REVERSE_ORDER(ii)(3 -(ii)) ;
3682 else nim->byteorder = ii ;
3683
3684
3685 /**- set dimensions of data array */
3686
3687 nim->ndim = nim->dim[0] = nhdr.dim[0];
3688 nim->nx = nim->dim[1] = nhdr.dim[1];
3689 nim->ny = nim->dim[2] = nhdr.dim[2];
3690 nim->nz = nim->dim[3] = nhdr.dim[3];
3691 nim->nt = nim->dim[4] = nhdr.dim[4];
3692 nim->nu = nim->dim[5] = nhdr.dim[5];
3693 nim->nv = nim->dim[6] = nhdr.dim[6];
3694 nim->nw = nim->dim[7] = nhdr.dim[7];
3695
3696 for( ii=1, nim->nvox=1; ii <= nhdr.dim[0]; ii++ )
3697 nim->nvox *= nhdr.dim[ii];
3698
3699 /**- set the type of data in voxels and how many bytes per voxel */
3700
3701 nim->datatype = nhdr.datatype ;
3702
3703 nifti_datatype_sizes( nim->datatype , &(nim->nbyper) , &(nim->swapsize) ) ;
3704 if( nim->nbyper == 0 ){ free(nim); ERREX("bad datatype")do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,("bad datatype")) ; return fp ; } while(0); }
3705
3706 /**- set the grid spacings */
3707
3708 nim->dx = nim->pixdim[1] = nhdr.pixdim[1] ;
3709 nim->dy = nim->pixdim[2] = nhdr.pixdim[2] ;
3710 nim->dz = nim->pixdim[3] = nhdr.pixdim[3] ;
3711 nim->dt = nim->pixdim[4] = nhdr.pixdim[4] ;
3712 nim->du = nim->pixdim[5] = nhdr.pixdim[5] ;
3713 nim->dv = nim->pixdim[6] = nhdr.pixdim[6] ;
3714 nim->dw = nim->pixdim[7] = nhdr.pixdim[7] ;
3715
3716 /**- compute qto_xyz transformation from pixel indexes (i,j,k) to (x,y,z) */
3717
3718 if( !is_nifti || nhdr.qform_code <= 0 ){
3719 /**- if not nifti or qform_code <= 0, use grid spacing for qto_xyz */
3720
3721 nim->qto_xyz.m[0][0] = nim->dx ; /* grid spacings */
3722 nim->qto_xyz.m[1][1] = nim->dy ; /* along diagonal */
3723 nim->qto_xyz.m[2][2] = nim->dz ;
3724
3725 /* off diagonal is zero */
3726
3727 nim->qto_xyz.m[0][1]=nim->qto_xyz.m[0][2]=nim->qto_xyz.m[0][3] = 0.0;
3728 nim->qto_xyz.m[1][0]=nim->qto_xyz.m[1][2]=nim->qto_xyz.m[1][3] = 0.0;
3729 nim->qto_xyz.m[2][0]=nim->qto_xyz.m[2][1]=nim->qto_xyz.m[2][3] = 0.0;
3730
3731 /* last row is always [ 0 0 0 1 ] */
3732
3733 nim->qto_xyz.m[3][0]=nim->qto_xyz.m[3][1]=nim->qto_xyz.m[3][2] = 0.0;
3734 nim->qto_xyz.m[3][3]= 1.0 ;
3735
3736 nim->qform_code = NIFTI_XFORM_UNKNOWN0 ;
3737
3738 if( g_opts.debug > 1 ) fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d no qform provided\n");
3739 } else {
3740 /**- else NIFTI: use the quaternion-specified transformation */
3741
3742 nim->quatern_b = nhdr.quatern_b;
3743 nim->quatern_c = nhdr.quatern_c;
3744 nim->quatern_d = nhdr.quatern_d;
3745
3746 nim->qoffset_x = nhdr.qoffset_x;
3747 nim->qoffset_y = nhdr.qoffset_y;
3748 nim->qoffset_z = nhdr.qoffset_z;
3749
3750 nim->qfac = (nhdr.pixdim[0] < 0.0) ? -1.0 : 1.0 ; /* left-handedness? */
3751
3752 nim->qto_xyz = nifti_quatern_to_mat44(
3753 nim->quatern_b, nim->quatern_c, nim->quatern_d,
3754 nim->qoffset_x, nim->qoffset_y, nim->qoffset_z,
3755 nim->dx , nim->dy , nim->dz ,
3756 nim->qfac ) ;
3757
3758 nim->qform_code = nhdr.qform_code ;
3759
3760 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
3761 nifti_disp_matrix_orient("-d qform orientations:\n", nim->qto_xyz);
3762 }
3763
3764 /**- load inverse transformation (x,y,z) -> (i,j,k) */
3765
3766 nim->qto_ijk = nifti_mat44_inverse( nim->qto_xyz ) ;
3767
3768 /**- load sto_xyz affine transformation, if present */
3769
3770 if( !is_nifti || nhdr.sform_code <= 0 ){
3771 /**- if not nifti or sform_code <= 0, then no sto transformation */
3772
3773 nim->sform_code = NIFTI_XFORM_UNKNOWN0 ;
3774
3775 if( g_opts.debug > 1 ) fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d no sform provided\n");
3776
3777 } else {
3778 /**- else set the sto transformation from srow_*[] */
3779
3780 nim->sto_xyz.m[0][0] = nhdr.srow_x[0] ;
3781 nim->sto_xyz.m[0][1] = nhdr.srow_x[1] ;
3782 nim->sto_xyz.m[0][2] = nhdr.srow_x[2] ;
3783 nim->sto_xyz.m[0][3] = nhdr.srow_x[3] ;
3784
3785 nim->sto_xyz.m[1][0] = nhdr.srow_y[0] ;
3786 nim->sto_xyz.m[1][1] = nhdr.srow_y[1] ;
3787 nim->sto_xyz.m[1][2] = nhdr.srow_y[2] ;
3788 nim->sto_xyz.m[1][3] = nhdr.srow_y[3] ;
3789
3790 nim->sto_xyz.m[2][0] = nhdr.srow_z[0] ;
3791 nim->sto_xyz.m[2][1] = nhdr.srow_z[1] ;
3792 nim->sto_xyz.m[2][2] = nhdr.srow_z[2] ;
3793 nim->sto_xyz.m[2][3] = nhdr.srow_z[3] ;
3794
3795 /* last row is always [ 0 0 0 1 ] */
3796
3797 nim->sto_xyz.m[3][0]=nim->sto_xyz.m[3][1]=nim->sto_xyz.m[3][2] = 0.0;
3798 nim->sto_xyz.m[3][3]= 1.0 ;
3799
3800 nim->sto_ijk = nifti_mat44_inverse( nim->sto_xyz ) ;
3801
3802 nim->sform_code = nhdr.sform_code ;
3803
3804 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
3805 nifti_disp_matrix_orient("-d sform orientations:\n", nim->sto_xyz);
3806 }
3807
3808 /**- set miscellaneous NIFTI stuff */
3809
3810 if( is_nifti ){
3811 nim->scl_slope = nhdr.scl_slope;
3812 nim->scl_inter = nhdr.scl_inter;
3813
3814 nim->intent_code = nhdr.intent_code ;
3815
3816 nim->intent_p1 = nhdr.intent_p1;
3817 nim->intent_p2 = nhdr.intent_p2;
3818 nim->intent_p3 = nhdr.intent_p3;
3819
3820 nim->toffset = nhdr.toffset;
3821
3822 memcpy(nim->intent_name,nhdr.intent_name,15); nim->intent_name[15] = '\0';
3823
3824 nim->xyz_units = XYZT_TO_SPACE(nhdr.xyzt_units)( (nhdr.xyzt_units) & 0x07 ) ;
3825 nim->time_units = XYZT_TO_TIME (nhdr.xyzt_units)( (nhdr.xyzt_units) & 0x38 ) ;
3826
3827 nim->freq_dim = DIM_INFO_TO_FREQ_DIM ( nhdr.dim_info )( ((nhdr.dim_info) ) & 0x03 ) ;
3828 nim->phase_dim = DIM_INFO_TO_PHASE_DIM( nhdr.dim_info )( ((nhdr.dim_info) >> 2) & 0x03 ) ;
3829 nim->slice_dim = DIM_INFO_TO_SLICE_DIM( nhdr.dim_info )( ((nhdr.dim_info) >> 4) & 0x03 ) ;
3830
3831 nim->slice_code = nhdr.slice_code ;
3832 nim->slice_start = nhdr.slice_start ;
3833 nim->slice_end = nhdr.slice_end ;
3834 nim->slice_duration = nhdr.slice_duration;
3835 }
3836
3837 /**- set Miscellaneous ANALYZE stuff */
3838
3839 nim->cal_min = nhdr.cal_min;
3840 nim->cal_max = nhdr.cal_max;
3841
3842 memcpy(nim->descrip ,nhdr.descrip ,79) ; nim->descrip [79] = '\0' ;
3843 memcpy(nim->aux_file,nhdr.aux_file,23) ; nim->aux_file[23] = '\0' ;
3844
3845 /**- set ioff from vox_offset (but at least sizeof(header)) */
3846
3847 is_onefile = is_nifti && NIFTI_ONEFILE(nhdr)( (nhdr).magic[1] == '+' ) ;
3848
3849 if( is_onefile ){
3850 ioff = (int)nhdr.vox_offset ;
3851 if( ioff < (int) sizeof(nhdr) ) ioff = (int) sizeof(nhdr) ;
3852 } else {
3853 ioff = (int)nhdr.vox_offset ;
3854 }
3855 nim->iname_offset = ioff ;
3856
3857
3858 /**- deal with file names if set */
3859 if (fname!=NULL((void*)0)) {
3860 nifti_set_filenames(nim,fname,0,0);
3861 if (nim->iname==NULL((void*)0)) { ERREX("bad filename")do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,("bad filename")) ; return fp ; } while(0); }
3862 } else {
3863 nim->fname = NULL((void*)0);
3864 nim->iname = NULL((void*)0);
3865 }
3866
3867 /* clear extension fields */
3868 nim->num_ext = 0;
3869 nim->ext_list = NULL((void*)0);
3870
3871 return nim;
3872}
3873
3874#undef ERREX
3875#define ERREX(msg)do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,(msg)) ; return fp ; } while(0) \
3876 do{ fprintf(stderrstderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_open(%s): %s\n", \
3877 (hname != NULL((void*)0)) ? hname : "(null)" , (msg) ) ; \
3878 return fptr ; } while(0)
3879
3880/***************************************************************
3881 * nifti_image_open
3882 ***************************************************************/
3883/*! znzFile nifti_image_open( char *hname, char *opts , nifti_image **nim)
3884 \brief Read in NIFTI-1 or ANALYZE-7.5 file (pair) header information into a nifti_image struct.
3885
3886 - The image data is not read from disk (it may be read later using
3887 nifti_image_load(), for example).
3888 - The image data will be stored in whatever data format the
3889 input data is; no scaling will be applied.
3890 - DT_BINARY data is not supported.
3891 - nifti_image_free() can be used to delete the returned struct,
3892 when you are done with it.
3893
3894 \param hname filename of dataset .hdr or .nii file
3895 \param opts options string for opening the header file
3896 \param nim pointer to pointer to nifti_image struct
3897 (this routine allocates the nifti_image struct)
3898 \return file pointer (gzippable) to the file with the image data,
3899 ready for reading.
3900 <br>NULL if something fails badly.
3901 \sa nifti_image_load, nifti_image_free
3902 */
3903znzFile nifti_image_open(const char * hname, char * opts, nifti_image ** nim)
3904{
3905 znzFile fptr=NULL((void*)0);
3906 /* open the hdr and reading it in, but do not load the data */
3907 *nim = nifti_image_read(hname,0);
3908 /* open the image file, ready for reading (compressed works for all reads) */
3909 if( ((*nim) == NULL((void*)0)) || ((*nim)->iname == NULL((void*)0)) ||
3910 ((*nim)->nbyper <= 0) || ((*nim)->nvox <= 0) )
3911 ERREX("bad header info")do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,("bad header info")) ; return fp ; } while(0) ;
3912
3913 /* open image data file */
3914 fptr = znzopen( (*nim)->iname, opts, nifti_is_gzfile((*nim)->iname) );
3915 if( znz_isnull(fptr)((fptr) == ((void*)0)) ) ERREX("Can't open data file")do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_write_hdr_img: %s\n"
,("Can't open data file")) ; return fp ; } while(0) ;
3916
3917 return fptr;
3918}
3919
3920
3921/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3922/*! return an allocated and filled nifti_1_header struct
3923
3924 Read the binary header from disk, and swap bytes if necessary.
3925
3926 \return an allocated nifti_1_header struct, or NULL on failure
3927
3928 \param hname name of file containing header
3929 \param swapped if not NULL, return whether header bytes were swapped
3930 \param check flag to check for invalid nifti_1_header
3931
3932 \warning ASCII header type is not supported
3933
3934 \sa nifti_image_read, nifti_image_free, nifti_image_read_bricks
3935*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3936nifti_1_header * nifti_read_header(const char * hname, int * swapped, int check)
3937{
3938 nifti_1_header nhdr, * hptr;
3939 znzFile fp;
3940 int bytes, lswap;
3941 char * hfile;
3942 char fname[] = { "nifti_read_header" };
3943
3944 /* determine file name to use for header */
3945 hfile = nifti_findhdrname(hname);
3946 if( hfile == NULL((void*)0) ){
3947 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
3948 LNI_FERR(fname,"failed to find header file for", hname)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"failed to find header file for"
,hname);
3949 return NULL((void*)0);
3950 } else if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
3951 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d %s: found header filename '%s'\n",fname,hfile);
3952
3953 fp = znzopen( hfile, "rb", nifti_is_gzfile(hfile) );
3954 if( znz_isnull(fp)((fp) == ((void*)0)) ){
3955 if( g_opts.debug > 0 ) LNI_FERR(fname,"failed to open header file",hfile)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"failed to open header file"
,hfile);
3956 free(hfile);
3957 return NULL((void*)0);
3958 }
3959
3960 free(hfile); /* done with filename */
3961
3962 if( has_ascii_header(fp) == 1 ){
3963 znzclose( fp )Xznzclose(&(fp));
3964 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
3965 LNI_FERR(fname,"ASCII header type not supported",hname)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"ASCII header type not supported"
,hname);
3966 return NULL((void*)0);
3967 }
3968
3969 /* read the binary header */
3970 bytes = (int)znzread( &nhdr, 1, sizeof(nhdr), fp );
3971 znzclose( fp )Xznzclose(&(fp)); /* we are done with the file now */
3972
3973 if( bytes < (int)sizeof(nhdr) ){
3974 if( g_opts.debug > 0 ){
3975 LNI_FERR(fname,"bad binary header read for file", hname)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"bad binary header read for file"
,hname);
3976 fprintf(stderrstderr," - read %d of %d bytes\n",bytes, (int)sizeof(nhdr));
3977 }
3978 return NULL((void*)0);
3979 }
3980
3981 /* now just decide on byte swapping */
3982 lswap = need_nhdr_swap(nhdr.dim[0], nhdr.sizeof_hdr); /* swap data flag */
3983 if( check && lswap < 0 ){
3984 LNI_FERR(fname,"bad nifti_1_header for file", hname)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"bad nifti_1_header for file"
,hname);
3985 return NULL((void*)0);
3986 } else if ( lswap < 0 ) {
3987 lswap = 0; /* if swapping does not help, don't do it */
3988 if(g_opts.debug > 1) fprintf(stderrstderr,"-- swap failure, none applied\n");
3989 }
3990
3991 if( lswap ) {
3992 if ( g_opts.debug > 3 ) disp_nifti_1_header("-d nhdr pre-swap: ", &nhdr);
3993 swap_nifti_header( &nhdr , NIFTI_VERSION(nhdr)( ( (nhdr).magic[0]=='n' && (nhdr).magic[3]=='\0' &&
( (nhdr).magic[1]=='i' || (nhdr).magic[1]=='+' ) && (
(nhdr).magic[2]>='1' && (nhdr).magic[2]<='9' )
) ? (nhdr).magic[2]-'0' : 0 ) ) ;
3994 }
3995
3996 if ( g_opts.debug > 2 ) disp_nifti_1_header("-d nhdr post-swap: ", &nhdr);
3997
3998 if ( check && ! nifti_hdr_looks_good(&nhdr) ){
3999 LNI_FERR(fname,"nifti_1_header looks bad for file", hname)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"nifti_1_header looks bad for file"
,hname);
4000 return NULL((void*)0);
4001 }
4002
4003 /* all looks good, so allocate memory for and return the header */
4004 hptr = (nifti_1_header *)malloc(sizeof(nifti_1_header));
4005 if( ! hptr ){
4006 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** nifti_read_hdr: failed to alloc nifti_1_header\n");
4007 return NULL((void*)0);
4008 }
4009
4010 if( swapped ) *swapped = lswap; /* only if they care <sniff!> */
4011
4012 memcpy(hptr, &nhdr, sizeof(nifti_1_header));
4013
4014 return hptr;
4015}
4016
4017
4018/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4019/*! decide if this nifti_1_header structure looks reasonable
4020
4021 Check dim[0], dim[1], sizeof_hdr, and datatype.
4022 Check magic string for "n+1".
4023 Maybe more tests will follow.
4024
4025 \return 1 if the header seems valid, 0 otherwise
4026
4027 \sa nifti_nim_is_valid, valid_nifti_extensions
4028*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4029int nifti_hdr_looks_good(const nifti_1_header * hdr)
4030{
4031 int is_nifti, c, errs = 0;
4032
4033 /* check dim[0] and sizeof_hdr */
4034 if( need_nhdr_swap(hdr->dim[0], hdr->sizeof_hdr) < 0 ){
4035 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
4036 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** bad nhdr fields: dim0, sizeof_hdr = %d, %d\n",
4037 hdr->dim[0], hdr->sizeof_hdr);
4038 errs++;
4039 }
4040
4041 /* check the valid dimension sizes (maybe dim[0] is bad) */
4042 for( c = 1; c <= hdr->dim[0] && c <= 7; c++ )
4043 if( hdr->dim[c] <= 0 ){
4044 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
4045 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** bad nhdr field: dim[%d] = %d\n",c,hdr->dim[c]);
4046 errs++;
4047 }
4048
4049 is_nifti = NIFTI_VERSION(*hdr)( ( (*hdr).magic[0]=='n' && (*hdr).magic[3]=='\0' &&
( (*hdr).magic[1]=='i' || (*hdr).magic[1]=='+' ) && (
(*hdr).magic[2]>='1' && (*hdr).magic[2]<='9' )
) ? (*hdr).magic[2]-'0' : 0 ); /* determine header type */
4050
4051 if( is_nifti ){ /* NIFTI */
4052
4053 if( ! nifti_datatype_is_valid(hdr->datatype, 1) ){
4054 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
4055 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** bad NIFTI datatype in hdr, %d\n",hdr->datatype);
4056 errs++;
4057 }
4058
4059 } else { /* ANALYZE 7.5 */
4060
4061 if( g_opts.debug > 1 ) /* maybe tell user it's an ANALYZE hdr */
4062 fprintf(stderrstderr,
4063 "-- nhdr magic field implies ANALYZE: magic = '%.4s'\n",hdr->magic);
4064
4065 if( ! nifti_datatype_is_valid(hdr->datatype, 0) ){
4066 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
4067 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** bad ANALYZE datatype in hdr, %d\n",hdr->datatype);
4068 errs++;
4069 }
4070 }
4071
4072 if( errs ) return 0; /* problems */
4073
4074 if( g_opts.debug > 2 ) fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d nifti header looks good\n");
4075
4076 return 1; /* looks good */
4077}
4078
4079
4080/*----------------------------------------------------------------------
4081 * check whether byte swapping is needed
4082 *
4083 * dim[0] should be in [0,7], and sizeof_hdr should be accurate
4084 *
4085 * \returns > 0 : needs swap
4086 * 0 : does not need swap
4087 * < 0 : error condition
4088 *----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4089static int need_nhdr_swap( short dim0, int hdrsize )
4090{
4091 short d0 = dim0; /* so we won't have to swap them on the stack */
4092 int hsize = hdrsize;
4093
4094 if( d0 != 0 ){ /* then use it for the check */
4095 if( d0 > 0 && d0 <= 7 ) return 0;
4096
4097 nifti_swap_2bytes(1, &d0); /* swap? */
4098 if( d0 > 0 && d0 <= 7 ) return 1;
4099
4100 if( g_opts.debug > 1 ){
4101 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** NIFTI: bad swapped d0 = %d, unswapped = ", d0);
4102 nifti_swap_2bytes(1, &d0); /* swap? */
4103 fprintf(stderrstderr,"%d\n", d0);
4104 }
4105
4106 return -1; /* bad, naughty d0 */
4107 }
4108
4109 /* dim[0] == 0 should not happen, but could, so try hdrsize */
4110 if( hsize == sizeof(nifti_1_header) ) return 0;
4111
4112 nifti_swap_4bytes(1, &hsize); /* swap? */
4113 if( hsize == sizeof(nifti_1_header) ) return 1;
4114
4115 if( g_opts.debug > 1 ){
4116 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** NIFTI: bad swapped hsize = %d, unswapped = ", hsize);
4117 nifti_swap_4bytes(1, &hsize); /* swap? */
4118 fprintf(stderrstderr,"%d\n", hsize);
4119 }
4120
4121 return -2; /* bad, naughty hsize */
4122}
4123
4124
4125/* use macro LNI_FILE_ERROR instead of ERREX()
4126#undef ERREX
4127#define ERREX(msg) \
4128 do{ fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR: nifti_image_read(%s): %s\n", \
4129 (hname != NULL) ? hname : "(null)" , (msg) ) ; \
4130 return NULL ; } while(0)
4131*/
4132
4133
4134/***************************************************************
4135 * nifti_image_read
4136 ***************************************************************/
4137/*! \brief Read a nifti header and optionally the data, creating a nifti_image.
4138
4139 - The data buffer will be byteswapped if necessary.
4140 - The data buffer will not be scaled.
4141 - The data buffer is allocated with calloc().
4142
4143 \param hname filename of the nifti dataset
4144 \param read_data Flag, true=read data blob, false=don't read blob.
4145 \return A pointer to the nifti_image data structure.
4146
4147 \sa nifti_image_free, nifti_free_extensions, nifti_image_read_bricks
4148*/
4149nifti_image *nifti_image_read( const char *hname , int read_data )
4150{
4151 struct nifti_1_header nhdr ;
4152 nifti_image *nim ;
4153 znzFile fp ;
4154 int rv, ii , filesize, remaining;
4155 char fname[] = { "nifti_image_read" };
4156 char *hfile=NULL((void*)0);
4157
4158 if( g_opts.debug > 1 ){
4159 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d image_read from '%s', read_data = %d",hname,read_data);
4160#ifdef HAVE_ZLIB1
4161 fprintf(stderrstderr,", HAVE_ZLIB = 1\n");
4162#else
4163 fprintf(stderrstderr,", HAVE_ZLIB = 0\n");
4164#endif
4165 }
4166
4167 /**- determine filename to use for header */
4168 hfile = nifti_findhdrname(hname);
4169 if( hfile == NULL((void*)0) ){
4170 if(g_opts.debug > 0)
4171 LNI_FERR(fname,"failed to find header file for", hname)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"failed to find header file for"
,hname);
4172 return NULL((void*)0); /* check return */
4173 } else if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
4174 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d %s: found header filename '%s'\n",fname,hfile);
4175
4176 if( nifti_is_gzfile(hfile) ) filesize = -1; /* unknown */
4177 else filesize = nifti_get_filesize(hfile);
4178
4179 fp = znzopen(hfile, "rb", nifti_is_gzfile(hfile));
4180 if( znz_isnull(fp)((fp) == ((void*)0)) ){
4181 if( g_opts.debug > 0 ) LNI_FERR(fname,"failed to open header file",hfile)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"failed to open header file"
,hfile);
4182 free(hfile);
4183 return NULL((void*)0);
4184 }
4185
4186 rv = has_ascii_header( fp );
4187 if( rv < 0 ){
4188 if( g_opts.debug > 0 ) LNI_FERR(fname,"short header read",hfile)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"short header read"
,hfile);
4189 znzclose( fp )Xznzclose(&(fp));
4190 free(hfile);
4191 return NULL((void*)0);
4192 }
4193 else if ( rv == 1 ) /* process special file type */
4194 return nifti_read_ascii_image( fp, hfile, filesize, read_data );
4195
4196 /* else, just process normally */
4197
4198 /**- read binary header */
4199
4200 ii = (int)znzread( &nhdr , 1 , sizeof(nhdr) , fp ) ; /* read the thing */
4201
4202 /* keep file open so we can check for exts. after nifti_convert_nhdr2nim() */
4203
4204 if( ii < (int) sizeof(nhdr) ){
4205 if( g_opts.debug > 0 ){
4206 LNI_FERR(fname,"bad binary header read for file", hfile)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"bad binary header read for file"
,hfile);
4207 fprintf(stderrstderr," - read %d of %d bytes\n",ii, (int)sizeof(nhdr));
4208 }
4209 znzclose(fp)Xznzclose(&(fp)) ;
4210 free(hfile);
4211 return NULL((void*)0);
4212 }
4213
4214 /* create output image struct and set it up */
4215
4216 /**- convert all nhdr fields to nifti_image fields */
4217 nim = nifti_convert_nhdr2nim(nhdr,hfile);
4218
4219 if( nim == NULL((void*)0) ){
4220 znzclose( fp )Xznzclose(&(fp)) ; /* close the file */
4221 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
4222 LNI_FERR(fname,"cannot create nifti image from header",hfile)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",fname,"cannot create nifti image from header"
,hfile);
4223 free(hfile); /* had to save this for debug message */
4224 return NULL((void*)0);
4225 }
4226
4227 if( g_opts.debug > 3 ){
4228 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d nifti_image_read(), have nifti image:\n");
4229 if( g_opts.debug > 2 ) nifti_image_infodump(nim);
4230 }
4231
4232 /**- check for extensions (any errors here means no extensions) */
4233 if( NIFTI_ONEFILE(nhdr)( (nhdr).magic[1] == '+' ) ) remaining = nim->iname_offset - sizeof(nhdr);
4234 else remaining = filesize - sizeof(nhdr);
4235
4236 (void)nifti_read_extensions(nim, fp, remaining);
4237
4238 znzclose( fp )Xznzclose(&(fp)) ; /* close the file */
4239 free(hfile);
4240
4241 /**- read the data if desired, then bug out */
4242 if( read_data ){
4243 if( nifti_image_load( nim ) < 0 ){
4244 nifti_image_free(nim); /* take ball, go home. */
4245 return NULL((void*)0);
4246 }
4247 }
4248 else nim->data = NULL((void*)0) ;
4249
4250 return nim ;
4251}
4252
4253
4254/*----------------------------------------------------------------------
4255 * has_ascii_header - see if the NIFTI header is an ASCII format
4256 *
4257 * If the file starts with the ASCII string "<nifti_image", then
4258 * process the dataset as a type-3 .nia file.
4259 *
4260 * return: -1 on error, 1 if true, or 0 if false
4261 *
4262 * NOTE: this is NOT part of the NIFTI-1 standard
4263 *----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4264static int has_ascii_header( znzFile fp )
4265{
4266 char buf[16];
4267 int nread;
4268
4269 if( znz_isnull(fp)((fp) == ((void*)0)) ) return 0;
4270
4271 nread = (int)znzread( buf, 1, 12, fp );
4272 buf[12] = '\0';
4273
4274 if( nread < 12 ) return -1;
4275
4276 znzrewind(fp); /* move back to the beginning, and check */
4277
4278 if( strcmp(buf, "<nifti_image") == 0 ) return 1;
4279
4280 return 0;
4281}
4282
4283
4284/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4285/*! nifti_read_ascii_image - process as a type-3 .nia image file
4286
4287 return NULL on failure
4288
4289 NOTE: this is NOT part of the NIFTI-1 standard
4290*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4291nifti_image * nifti_read_ascii_image(znzFile fp, char *fname, int flen,
4292 int read_data)
4293{
4294 nifti_image * nim;
4295 int slen, txt_size, remain, rv = 0;
4296 char * sbuf, lfunc[25] = { "nifti_read_ascii_image" };
4297
4298 if( nifti_is_gzfile(fname) ){
4299 LNI_FERR(lfunc,"compression not supported for file type NIFTI_FTYPE_ASCII",fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",lfunc,"compression not supported for file type NIFTI_FTYPE_ASCII"
,fname)
4300 fname)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",lfunc,"compression not supported for file type NIFTI_FTYPE_ASCII"
,fname);
4301 free(fname); znzclose(fp)Xznzclose(&(fp)); return NULL((void*)0);
4302 }
4303 slen = flen; /* slen will be our buffer length */
4304
4305 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
4306 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d %s: have ASCII NIFTI file of size %d\n",fname,slen);
4307
4308 if( slen > 65530 ) slen = 65530 ;
4309 sbuf = (char *)calloc(sizeof(char),slen+1) ;
4310 if( !sbuf ){
4311 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** %s: failed to alloc %d bytes for sbuf",lfunc,65530);
4312 free(fname); znzclose(fp)Xznzclose(&(fp)); return NULL((void*)0);
4313 }
4314 znzread( sbuf , 1 , slen , fp ) ;
4315 nim = nifti_image_from_ascii( sbuf, &txt_size ) ; free( sbuf ) ;
4316 if( nim == NULL((void*)0) ){
4317 LNI_FERR(lfunc,"failed nifti_image_from_ascii()",fname)fprintf(stderr,"** ERROR (%s): %s '%s'\n",lfunc,"failed nifti_image_from_ascii()"
,fname);
4318 free(fname); znzclose(fp)Xznzclose(&(fp)); return NULL((void*)0);
4319 }
4320 nim->nifti_type = NIFTI_FTYPE_ASCII3 ;
4321
4322 /* compute remaining space for extensions */
4323 remain = flen - txt_size - (int)nifti_get_volsize(nim);
4324 if( remain > 4 ){
4325 /* read extensions (reposition file pointer, first) */
4326 znzseek(fp, txt_size, SEEK_SET0);
4327 (void) nifti_read_extensions(nim, fp, remain);
4328 }
4329
4330 free(fname);
4331 znzclose( fp )Xznzclose(&(fp)) ;
4332
4333 nim->iname_offset = -1 ; /* check from the end of the file */
4334
4335 if( read_data ) rv = nifti_image_load( nim ) ;
4336 else nim->data = NULL((void*)0) ;
4337
4338 /* check for nifti_image_load() failure, maybe bail out */
4339 if( read_data && rv != 0 ){
4340 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
4341 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d failed image_load, free nifti image struct\n");
4342 free(nim);
4343 return NULL((void*)0);
4344 }
4345
4346 return nim ;
4347}
4348
4349
4350/*----------------------------------------------------------------------
4351 * Read the extensions into the nifti_image struct 08 Dec 2004 [rickr]
4352 *
4353 * This function is called just after the header struct is read in, and
4354 * it is assumed the file pointer has not moved. The value in remain
4355 * is assumed to be accurate, reflecting the bytes of space for potential
4356 * extensions.
4357 *
4358 * return the number of extensions read in, or < 0 on error
4359 *----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4360static int nifti_read_extensions( nifti_image *nim, znzFile fp, int remain )
4361{
4362 nifti1_extender extdr; /* defines extension existence */
4363 nifti1_extension extn; /* single extension to process */
4364 nifti1_extension * Elist; /* list of processed extensions */
4365 int posn, count;
4366
4367 if( !nim || znz_isnull(fp)((fp) == ((void*)0)) ) {
4368 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
4369 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** nifti_read_extensions: bad inputs (%p,%p)\n",
4370 (void *)nim, (void *)fp);
4371 return -1;
4372 }
4373
4374 posn = znztell(fp);
4375
4376 if( (posn != sizeof(nifti_1_header)) &&
4377 (nim->nifti_type != NIFTI_FTYPE_ASCII3) )
4378 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** WARNING: posn not header size (%d, %d)\n",
4379 posn, (int)sizeof(nifti_1_header));
4380
4381 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
4382 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d nre: posn = %d, offset = %d, type = %d, remain = %d\n",
4383 posn, nim->iname_offset, nim->nifti_type, remain);
4384
4385 if( remain < 16 ){
4386 if( g_opts.debug > 2 ){
4387 if( g_opts.skip_blank_ext )
4388 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d no extender in '%s' is okay, as "
4389 "skip_blank_ext is set\n",nim->fname);
4390 else
4391 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d remain=%d, no space for extensions\n",remain);
4392 }
4393 return 0;
4394 }
4395
4396 count = (int)znzread( extdr.extension, 1, 4, fp ); /* get extender */
4397
4398 if( count < 4 ){
4399 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
4400 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d file '%s' is too short for an extender\n",
4401 nim->fname);
4402 return 0;
4403 }
4404
4405 if( extdr.extension[0] != 1 ){
4406 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
4407 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d extender[0] (%d) shows no extensions for '%s'\n",
4408 extdr.extension[0], nim->fname);
4409 return 0;
4410 }
4411
4412 remain -= 4;
4413 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
4414 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d found valid 4-byte extender, remain = %d\n", remain);
4415
4416 /* so we expect extensions, but have no idea of how many there may be */
4417
4418 count = 0;
4419 Elist = NULL((void*)0);
4420 while (nifti_read_next_extension(&extn, nim, remain, fp) > 0)
4421 {
4422 if( nifti_add_exten_to_list(&extn, &Elist, count+1) < 0 ){
4423 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
4424 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** failed adding ext %d to list\n", count);
4425 return -1;
4426 }
4427
4428 /* we have a new extension */
4429 if( g_opts.debug > 1 ){
4430 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d found extension #%d, code = 0x%x, size = %d\n",
4431 count, extn.ecode, extn.esize);
4432 if( extn.ecode == NIFTI_ECODE_AFNI4 && g_opts.debug > 2 ) /* ~XML */
4433 fprintf(stderrstderr," AFNI extension: %.*s\n",
4434 extn.esize-8,extn.edata);
4435 else if( extn.ecode == NIFTI_ECODE_COMMENT6 && g_opts.debug > 2 )
4436 fprintf(stderrstderr," COMMENT extension: %.*s\n", /* TEXT */
4437 extn.esize-8,extn.edata);
4438 }
4439 remain -= extn.esize;
4440 count++;
4441 }
4442
4443 if( g_opts.debug > 2 ) fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d found %d extension(s)\n", count);
4444
4445 nim->num_ext = count;
4446 nim->ext_list = Elist;
4447
4448 return count;
4449}
4450
4451
4452/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4453/*! nifti_add_extension - add an extension, with a copy of the data
4454
4455 Add an extension to the nim->ext_list array.
4456 Fill this extension with a copy of the data, noting the
4457 length and extension code.
4458
4459 \param nim - nifti_image to add extension to
4460 \param data - raw extension data
4461 \param length - length of raw extension data
4462 \param ecode - extension code
4463
4464 \sa extension codes NIFTI_ECODE_* in nifti1_io.h
4465 \sa nifti_free_extensions, valid_nifti_extensions, nifti_copy_extensions
4466
4467 \return 0 on success, -1 on error (and free the entire list)
4468*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4469int nifti_add_extension(nifti_image *nim, const char * data, int len, int ecode)
4470{
4471 nifti1_extension ext;
4472
4473 /* error are printed in functions */
4474 if( nifti_fill_extension(&ext, data, len, ecode) ) return -1;
4475 if( nifti_add_exten_to_list(&ext, &nim->ext_list, nim->num_ext+1)) return -1;
4476
4477 nim->num_ext++; /* success, so increment */
4478
4479 return 0;
4480}
4481
4482
4483/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4484/* nifti_add_exten_to_list - add a new nifti1_extension to the list
4485
4486 We will append via "malloc, copy and free", because on an error,
4487 the list will revert to the previous one (sorry realloc(), only
4488 quality dolphins get to become part of St@rk!st brand tunafish).
4489
4490 return 0 on success, -1 on error (and free the entire list)
4491*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4492static int nifti_add_exten_to_list( nifti1_extension * new_ext,
4493 nifti1_extension ** list, int new_length )
4494{
4495 nifti1_extension * tmplist;
4496
4497 tmplist = *list;
4498 *list = (nifti1_extension *)malloc(new_length * sizeof(nifti1_extension));
4499
4500 /* check for failure first */
4501 if( ! *list ){
4502 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** failed to alloc %d extension structs (%d bytes)\n",
4503 new_length, new_length*(int)sizeof(nifti1_extension));
4504 if( !tmplist ) return -1; /* no old list to lose */
4505
4506 *list = tmplist; /* reset list to old one */
4507 return -1;
4508 }
4509
4510 /* if an old list exists, copy the pointers and free the list */
4511 if( tmplist ){
4512 memcpy(*list, tmplist, (new_length-1)*sizeof(nifti1_extension));
4513 free(tmplist);
4514 }
4515
4516 /* for some reason, I just don't like struct copy... */
4517 (*list)[new_length-1].esize = new_ext->esize;
4518 (*list)[new_length-1].ecode = new_ext->ecode;
4519 (*list)[new_length-1].edata = new_ext->edata;
4520
4521 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
4522 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d allocated and appended extension #%d to list\n",
4523 new_length);
4524
4525 return 0;
4526}
4527
4528
4529/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4530/* nifti_fill_extension - given data and length, fill an extension struct
4531
4532 Allocate memory for data, copy data, set the size and code.
4533
4534 return 0 on success, -1 on error (and free the entire list)
4535*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4536static int nifti_fill_extension( nifti1_extension *ext, const char * data,
4537 int len, int ecode)
4538{
4539 int esize;
4540
4541 if( !ext || !data || len < 0 ){
4542 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** fill_ext: bad params (%p,%p,%d)\n",
4543 (void *)ext, data, len);
4544 return -1;
4545 }
4546
4547 /* compute esize, first : len+8, and take ceiling up to a mult of 16 */
4548 esize = len+8;
4549 if( esize & 0xf ) esize = (esize + 0xf) & ~0xf;
4550 ext->esize = esize;
4551
4552 /* allocate esize-8 (maybe more than len), using calloc for fill */
4553 ext->edata = (char *)calloc(esize-8, sizeof(char));
4554 if( !ext->edata ){
4555 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** NFE: failed to alloc %d bytes for extension\n",len);
4556 return -1;
4557 }
4558
4559 memcpy(ext->edata, data, len); /* copy the data, using len */
4560 ext->ecode = ecode; /* set the ecode */
4561
4562 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
4563 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d alloc %d bytes for ext len %d, ecode %d, esize %d\n",
4564 esize-8, len, ecode, esize);
4565
4566 return 0;
4567}
4568
4569
4570/*----------------------------------------------------------------------
4571 * nifti_read_next_extension - read a single extension from the file
4572 *
4573 * return (>= 0 is okay):
4574 *
4575 * success : esize
4576 * no extension : 0
4577 * error : -1
4578 *----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4579static int nifti_read_next_extension( nifti1_extension * nex, nifti_image *nim,
4580 int remain, znzFile fp )
4581{
4582 int swap = nim->byteorder != nifti_short_order();
4583 int count, size, code;
4584
4585 /* first clear nex */
4586 nex->esize = nex->ecode = 0;
4587 nex->edata = NULL((void*)0);
4588
4589 if( remain < 16 ){
1
Assuming 'remain' is >= 16
2
Taking false branch
4590 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
4591 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d only %d bytes remain, so no extension\n", remain);
4592 return 0;
4593 }
4594
4595 /* must start with 4-byte size and code */
4596 count = (int)znzread( &size, 4, 1, fp );
4597 if( count == 1 ) count += (int)znzread( &code, 4, 1, fp );
3
Assuming 'count' is equal to 1
4
Taking false branch
4598
4599 if( count != 2 ){
5
Assuming 'count' is not equal to 2
6
Taking false branch
4600 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
4601 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d current extension read failed\n");
4602 znzseek(fp, -4*count, SEEK_CUR1); /* back up past any read */
4603 return 0; /* no extension, no error condition */
4604 }
4605
4606 if( swap ){
7
Assuming 'swap' is not equal to 0
8
Taking true branch
4607 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
9
Taking true branch
4608 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d pre-swap exts: code %d, size %d\n", code, size);
10
Function call argument is an uninitialized value
4609
4610 nifti_swap_4bytes(1, &size);
4611 nifti_swap_4bytes(1, &code);
4612 }
4613
4614 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
4615 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d potential extension: code %d, size %d\n", code, size);
4616
4617 if( !nifti_check_extension(nim, size, code, remain) ){
4618 if( znzseek(fp, -8, SEEK_CUR1) < 0 ){ /* back up past any read */
4619 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** failure to back out of extension read!\n");
4620 return -1;
4621 }
4622 return 0;
4623 }
4624
4625 /* now get the actual data */
4626 nex->esize = size;
4627 nex->ecode = code;
4628
4629 size -= 8; /* subtract space for size and code in extension */
4630 nex->edata = (char *)malloc(size * sizeof(char));
4631 if( !nex->edata ){
4632 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** failed to allocate %d bytes for extension\n",size);
4633 return -1;
4634 }
4635
4636 count = (int)znzread(nex->edata, 1, size, fp);
4637 if( count < size ){
4638 if( g_opts.debug > 0 )
4639 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d read only %d (of %d) bytes for extension\n",
4640 count, size);
4641 free(nex->edata);
4642 nex->edata = NULL((void*)0);
4643 return -1;
4644 }
4645
4646 /* success! */
4647 if( g_opts.debug > 2 )
4648 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d successfully read extension, code %d, size %d\n",
4649 nex->ecode, nex->esize);
4650
4651 return nex->esize;
4652}
4653
4654
4655/*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4656/*! for each extension, check code, size and data pointer
4657*//*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
4658int valid_nifti_extensions(const nifti_image * nim)
4659{
4660 nifti1_extension * ext;
4661 int c, errs;
4662
4663 if( nim->num_ext <= 0 || nim->ext_list == NULL((void*)0) ){
4664 if( g_opts.debug > 2 ) fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d empty extension list\n");
4665 return 0;
4666 }
4667
4668 /* for each extension, check code, size and data pointer */
4669 ext = nim->ext_list;
4670 errs = 0;
4671 for ( c = 0; c < nim->num_ext; c++ ){
4672
4673 if( ext->esize <= 0 ){
4674 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
4675 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d ext %d, bad size = %d\n", c, ext->esize);
