6718 for( c = 1; c <= nim->dim[0]; c++ ){
6719 if( dims[c] >= nim->dim[c] ){
6720 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** nifti_RCI: dims[%d] >= nim->dim[%d] (%d,%d)\n",
6721 c, c, dims[c], nim->dim[c]);
6722 return -1;
6723 }
6724 }
6725
6726 /** - prepare pivot list - pivots are fixed indices */
6727 if( make_pivot_list(nim, dims, pivots, prods, &nprods) < 0 ) return -1;
6728
6729 bytes = rci_alloc_mem(data, prods, nprods, nim->nbyper);
6730 if( bytes < 0 ) return -1;
6731
6732 /** - open the image file for reading at the appropriate offset */
6733 fp = nifti_image_load_prep( nim );
6734 if( ! fp ){ free(*data); *data = NULL((void*)0); return -1; } /* failure */
6735
6736 /** - call the recursive reading function, passing nim, the pivot info,
6737 location to store memory, and file pointer and position */
6738 c = rci_read_data(nim, pivots,prods,nprods,dims,
6739 (char *)*data, fp, znztell(fp));
6740 znzclose(fp)Xznzclose(&(fp)); /* in any case, close the file */
6741 if( c < 0 ){ free(*data); *data = NULL((void*)0); return -1; } /* failure */
6742
6743 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
6744 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d read %d bytes of collapsed image from %s\n",
6745 bytes, nim->fname);
6746
6747 return bytes;
6748}
6749
6750
6751/* local function to find strides per dimension. assumes 7D size and
6752** stride array.
6753*/
6754static void
6755compute_strides(int *strides,const int *size,int nbyper)
6756{
6757 int i;
6758 strides[0] = nbyper;
6759 for(i = 1; i < 7; i++)
6760 {
6761 strides[i] = size[i-1] * strides[i-1];
6762 }
6763}
6764
6765/*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6766/*! read an arbitrary subregion from a nifti image
6767
6768 This function may be used to read a single arbitary subregion of any
6769 rectangular size from a nifti dataset, such as a small 5x5x5 subregion
6770 around the center of a 3D image.
6771
6772 \param nim given nifti_image struct, corresponding to the data file
6773 \param start_index the index location of the first voxel that will be returned
6774 \param region_size the size of the subregion to be returned
6775 \param data pointer to data pointer (if *data is NULL, data will be
6776 allocated, otherwise not)
6777
6778 Example: given nim->dim[8] = {3, 64, 64, 64, 1, 1, 1, 1 } (3-D dataset)
6779
6780 if start_index[7] = { 29, 29, 29, 0, 0, 0, 0 } and
6781 region_size[7] = { 5, 5, 5, 1, 1, 1, 1 }
6782 -> read 5x5x5 region starting with the first voxel location at (29,29,29)
6783
6784 NOTE: If *data is not NULL, then it will be assumed that it points to
6785 valid memory, sufficient to hold the results. This is done for
6786 speed and possibly repeated calls to this function.
6787 \return
6788 - the total number of bytes read, or < 0 on failure
6789 - the read and byte-swapped data, in 'data' </pre>
6790
6791 \sa nifti_image_read, nifti_image_free, nifti_image_read_bricks
6792 nifti_image_load, nifti_read_collapsed_image
6793*//*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6794int nifti_read_subregion_image( nifti_image * nim,
6795 int *start_index,
6796 int *region_size,
6797 void ** data )
6798{
6799 znzFile fp; /* file to read */
6800 int i,j,k,l,m,n; /* indices for dims */
6801 long int bytes = 0; /* total # bytes read */
6802 int total_alloc_size; /* size of buffer allocation */
6803 char *readptr; /* where in *data to read next */
6804 int strides[7]; /* strides between dimensions */
6805 int collapsed_dims[8]; /* for read_collapsed_image */
6806 int *image_size; /* pointer to dimensions in header */
6807 long int initial_offset;
6808 long int offset; /* seek offset for reading current row */
6809
6810 /* probably ignored, but set to ndim for consistency*/
6811 collapsed_dims[0] = nim->ndim;
6812
6813 /* build a dims array for collapsed image read */
6814 for(i = 0; i < nim->ndim; i++)
6815 {
6816 /* if you take the whole extent in this dimension */
6817 if(start_index[i] == 0 &&
6818 region_size[i] == nim->dim[i+1])
6819 {
6820 collapsed_dims[i+1] = -1;
6821 }
6822 /* if you specify a single element in this dimension */
6823 else if(region_size[i] == 1)
6824 {
6825 collapsed_dims[i+1] = start_index[i];
6826 }
6827 else
6828 {
6829 collapsed_dims[i+1] = -2; /* sentinel value */
6830 }
6831 }
6832 /* fill out end of collapsed_dims */
6833 for(i = nim->ndim ; i < 7; i++)
6834 {
6835 collapsed_dims[i+1] = -1;
6836 }
6837
6838 /* check to see whether collapsed read is possible */
6839 for(i = 1; i <= nim->ndim; i++)
6840 {
6841 if(collapsed_dims[i] == -2)
6842 {
6843 break;
6844 }
6845 }
6846
6847 /* if you get through all the dimensions without hitting
6848 ** a subrange of size > 1, a collapsed read is possible
6849 */
6850 if(i > nim->ndim)
6851 {
6852 return nifti_read_collapsed_image(nim, collapsed_dims, data);
6853 }
6854
6855 /* point past first element of dim, which holds nim->ndim */
6856 image_size = &(nim->dim[1]);
6857
6858 /* check region sizes for sanity */
6859 for(i = 0; i < nim->ndim; i++)
6860 {
6861 if(start_index[i] + region_size[i] > image_size[i])
6862 {
6863 if(g_opts.debug > 1)
6864 {
6865 fprintf(stderrstderr,"region doesn't fit within image size\n");
6866 }
6867 return -1;
6868 }
6869 }
6870
6871 /* get the file open */
6872 fp = nifti_image_load_prep( nim );
6873 /* the current offset is just past the nifti header, save
6874 * location so that SEEK_SET can be used below
6875 */
6876 initial_offset = znztell(fp);
6877 /* get strides*/
6878 compute_strides(strides,image_size,nim->nbyper);
6879
6880 total_alloc_size = nim->nbyper; /* size of pixel */
6881
6882 /* find alloc size */
6883 for(i = 0; i < nim->ndim; i++)
6884 {
6885 total_alloc_size *= region_size[i];
6886 }
6887 /* allocate buffer, if necessary */
6888 if(*data == 0)
6889 {
6890 *data = (void *)malloc(total_alloc_size);
6891 }
6892
6893 if(*data == 0)
6894 {
6895 if(g_opts.debug > 1)
6896 {
6897 fprintf(stderrstderr,"allocation of %d bytes failed\n",total_alloc_size);
6898 return -1;
6899 }
6900 }
6901
6902 /* point to start of data buffer as char * */
6903 readptr = *((char **)data);
6904 {
6905 /* can't assume that start_index and region_size have any more than
6906 ** nim->ndim elements so make local copies, filled out to seven elements
6907 */
6908 int si[7], rs[7];
6909 for(i = 0; i < nim->ndim; i++)
6910 {
6911 si[i] = start_index[i];
6912 rs[i] = region_size[i];
6913 }
6914 for(i = nim->ndim; i < 7; i++)
6915 {
6916 si[i] = 0;
6917 rs[i] = 1;
6918 }
6919 /* loop through subregion and read a row at a time */
6920 for(i = si[6]; i < (si[6] + rs[6]); i++)
6921 {
6922 for(j = si[5]; j < (si[5] + rs[5]); j++)
6923 {
6924 for(k = si[4]; k < (si[4] + rs[4]); k++)
6925 {
6926 for(l = si[3]; l < (si[3] + rs[3]); l++)
6927 {
6928 for(m = si[2]; m < (si[2] + rs[2]); m++)
6929 {
6930 for(n = si[1]; n < (si[1] + rs[1]); n++)
6931 {
6932 int nread,read_amount;
6933 offset = initial_offset +
6934 (i * strides[6]) +
6935 (j * strides[5]) +
6936 (k * strides[4]) +
6937 (l * strides[3]) +
6938 (m * strides[2]) +
6939 (n * strides[1]) +
6940 (si[0] * strides[0]);
6941 znzseek(fp, offset, SEEK_SET0); /* seek to current row */
6942 read_amount = rs[0] * nim->nbyper; /* read a row of the subregion*/
6943 nread = (int)nifti_read_buffer(fp, readptr, read_amount, nim);
6944 if(nread != read_amount)
6945 {
6946 if(g_opts.debug > 1)
6947 {
6948 fprintf(stderrstderr,"read of %d bytes failed\n",read_amount);
6949 return -1;
6950 }
6951 }
6952 bytes += nread;
6953 readptr += read_amount;
6954 }
6955 }
6956 }
6957 }
6958 }
6959 }
6960 }
6961 return bytes;
6962}
6963
6964
6965/* read the data from the file pointed to by fp
6966
6967 - this a recursive function, so start with the base case
6968 - data is now (char *) for easy incrementing
6969
6970 return 0 on success, < 0 on failure
6971*/
6972static int rci_read_data(nifti_image * nim, int * pivots, int * prods,
6973 int nprods, const int dims[], char * data, znzFile fp, size_t base_offset)
6974{
6975 size_t sublen, offset, read_size;
6976 int c;
6977
6978 /* bad check first - base_offset may not have been checked */
6979 if( nprods <= 0 ){
6980 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** rci_read_data, bad prods, %d\n", nprods);
6981 return -1;
6982 }
6983
6984 /* base case: actually read the data */
6985 if( nprods == 1 ){
6986 size_t nread, bytes;
6987
6988 /* make sure things look good here */
6989 if( *pivots != 0 ){
6990 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** rciRD: final pivot == %d!\n", *pivots);
6991 return -1;
6992 }
6993
6994 /* so just seek and read (prods[0] * nbyper) bytes from the file */
6995 znzseek(fp, (long)base_offset, SEEK_SET0);
6996 bytes = (size_t)prods[0] * nim->nbyper;
6997 nread = nifti_read_buffer(fp, data, bytes, nim);
6998 if( nread != bytes ){
6999 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** rciRD: read only %u of %u bytes from '%s'\n",
7000 (unsigned)nread, (unsigned)bytes, nim->fname);
7001 return -1;
7002 } else if( g_opts.debug > 3 )
7003 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d successful read of %u bytes at offset %u\n",
7004 (unsigned)bytes, (unsigned)base_offset);
7005
7006 return 0; /* done with base case - return success */
7007 }
7008
7009 /* not the base case, so do a set of reduced reads */
7010
7011 /* compute size of sub-brick: all dimensions below pivot */
7012 for( c = 1, sublen = 1; c < *pivots; c++ ) sublen *= nim->dim[c];
7013
7014 /* compute number of values to read, i.e. remaining prods */
7015 for( c = 1, read_size = 1; c < nprods; c++ ) read_size *= prods[c];
7016 read_size *= nim->nbyper; /* and multiply by bytes per voxel */
7017
7018 /* now repeatedly compute offsets, and recursively read */
7019 for( c = 0; c < prods[0]; c++ ){
7020 /* offset is (c * sub-block size (including pivot dim)) */
7021 /* + (dims[] index into pivot sub-block) */
7022 /* the unneeded multiplication is to make this more clear */
7023 offset = (size_t)c * sublen * nim->dim[*pivots] +
7024 (size_t)sublen * dims[*pivots];
7025 offset *= nim->nbyper;
7026
7027 if( g_opts.debug > 3 )
7028 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d reading %u bytes, foff %u + %u, doff %u\n",
7029 (unsigned)read_size, (unsigned)base_offset, (unsigned)offset,
7030 (unsigned)(c*read_size));
7031
7032 /* now read the next level down, adding this offset */
7033 if( rci_read_data(nim, pivots+1, prods+1, nprods-1, dims,
7034 data + c * read_size, fp, base_offset + offset) < 0 )
7035 return -1;
7036 }
7037
7038 return 0;
7039}
7040
7041
7042/* allocate memory for all collapsed image data
7043
7044 If *data is already set, do not allocate, but still calculate
7045 size for debug report.
7046
7047 return total size on success, and < 0 on failure
7048*/
7049static int rci_alloc_mem(void ** data, int prods[8], int nprods, int nbyper )
7050{
7051 int size, index;
7052
7053 if( nbyper < 0 || nprods < 1 || nprods > 8 ){
7054 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** rci_am: bad params, %d, %d\n", nbyper, nprods);
7055 return -1;
7056 }
7057
7058 for( index = 0, size = 1; index < nprods; index++ )
7059 size *= prods[index];
7060
7061 size *= nbyper;
7062
7063 if( ! *data ){ /* then allocate what is needed */
7064 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
7065 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d alloc %d (= %d x %d) bytes for collapsed image\n",
7066 size, size/nbyper, nbyper);
7067
7068 *data = malloc(size); /* actually allocate the memory */
7069 if( ! *data ){
7070 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** rci_am: failed to alloc %d bytes for data\n", size);
7071 return -1;
7072 }
7073 } else if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
7074 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d rci_am: *data already set, need %d (%d x %d) bytes\n",
7075 size, size/nbyper, nbyper);
7076
7077 return size;
7078}
7079
7080
7081/* prepare a pivot list for reading
7082
7083 The pivot points are the indices into dims where the calling function
7084 wants to collapse a dimension. The last pivot should always be zero
7085 (note that we have space for that in the lists).
7086*/
7087static int make_pivot_list(nifti_image * nim, const int dims[], int pivots[],
7088 int prods[], int * nprods )
7089{
7090 int len, index;
7091
7092 len = 0;
7093 index = nim->dim[0];
7094 while( index > 0 ){
7095 prods[len] = 1;
7096 while( index > 0 && (nim->dim[index] == 1 || dims[index] == -1) ){
7097 prods[len] *= nim->dim[index];
7098 index--;
7099 }
7100 pivots[len] = index;
7101 len++;
7102 index--; /* fine, let it drop out at -1 */
7103 }
7104
7105 /* make sure to include 0 as a pivot (instead of just 1, if it is) */
7106 if( pivots[len-1] != 0 ){
7107 pivots[len] = 0;
7108 prods[len] = 1;
7109 len++;
7110 }
7111
7112 *nprods = len;
7113
7114 if( g_opts.debug > 2 ){
7115 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d pivot list created, pivots :");
7116 for(index = 0; index < len; index++) fprintf(stderrstderr," %d", pivots[index]);
7117 fprintf(stderrstderr,", prods :");
7118 for(index = 0; index < len; index++) fprintf(stderrstderr," %d", prods[index]);
7119 fputc('\n',stderrstderr);
7120 }
7121
7122 return 0;
7123}
7124
7125
7126#undef ISEND
7127#define ISEND(c)( (c)==']' || (c)=='}' || (c)=='\0' ) ( (c)==']' || (c)=='}' || (c)=='\0' )
7128
7129/*---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7130/*! Get an integer list in the range 0..(nvals-1), from the
7131 character string str. If we call the output pointer fred,
7132 then fred[0] = number of integers in the list (> 0), and
7133 fred[i] = i-th integer in the list for i=1..fred[0].
7134 If on return, fred == NULL or fred[0] == 0, then something is
7135 wrong, and the caller must deal with that.
7136
7137 Syntax of input string:
7138 - initial '{' or '[' is skipped, if present
7139 - ends when '}' or ']' or end of string is found
7140 - contains entries separated by commas
7141 - entries have one of these forms:
7142 - a single number
7143 - a dollar sign '$', which means nvals-1
7144 - a sequence of consecutive numbers in the form "a..b" or
7145 "a-b", where "a" and "b" are single numbers (or '$')
7146 - a sequence of evenly spaced numbers in the form
7147 "a..b(c)" or "a-b(c)", where "c" encodes the step
7148 - Example: "[2,7..4,3..9(2)]" decodes to the list
7149 2 7 6 5 4 3 5 7 9
7150 - entries should be in the range 0..nvals-1
7151
7152 (borrowed, with permission, from thd_intlist.c)
7153*//*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7154int * nifti_get_intlist( int nvals , const char * str )
7155{
7156 int *subv = NULL((void*)0) ;
7157 int ii , ipos , nout , slen ;
7158 int ibot,itop,istep , nused ;
7159 char *cpt ;
7160
7161 /* Meaningless input? */
7162 if( nvals < 1 ) return NULL((void*)0) ;
7163
7164 /* No selection list? */
7165 if( str == NULL((void*)0) || str[0] == '\0' ) return NULL((void*)0) ;
7166
7167 /* skip initial '[' or '{' */
7168 subv = (int *)malloc( sizeof(int) * 2 ) ;
7169 if( !subv ) {
7170 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** nifti_get_intlist: failed alloc of 2 ints\n");
7171 return NULL((void*)0);
7172 }
7173 subv[0] = nout = 0 ;
7174
7175 ipos = 0 ;
7176 if( str[ipos] == '[' || str[ipos] == '{' ) ipos++ ;
7177
7178 if( g_opts.debug > 1 )
7179 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-d making int_list (vals = %d) from '%s'\n", nvals, str);
7180
7181 /**- for each sub-selector until end of input... */
7182
7183 slen = (int)strlen(str) ;
7184 while( ipos < slen && !ISEND(str[ipos])( (str[ipos])==']' || (str[ipos])=='}' || (str[ipos])=='\0' ) ){
7185
7186 while( isspace((int) str[ipos])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) (((int) str[ipos]))] & (unsigned
short int) _ISspace) ) ipos++ ; /* skip blanks */
7187 if( ISEND(str[ipos])( (str[ipos])==']' || (str[ipos])=='}' || (str[ipos])=='\0' ) ) break ; /* done */
7188
7189 /**- get starting value */
7190
7191 if( str[ipos] == '$' ){ /* special case */
7192 ibot = nvals-1 ; ipos++ ;
7193 } else { /* decode an integer */
7194 ibot = strtol( str+ipos , &cpt , 10 ) ;
7195 if( ibot < 0 ){
7196 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** ERROR: list index %d is out of range 0..%d\n",
7197 ibot,nvals-1) ;
7198 free(subv) ; return NULL((void*)0) ;
7199 }
7200 if( ibot >= nvals ){
7201 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** ERROR: list index %d is out of range 0..%d\n",
7202 ibot,nvals-1) ;
7203 free(subv) ; return NULL((void*)0) ;
7204 }
7205 nused = (cpt-(str+ipos)) ;
7206 if( ibot == 0 && nused == 0 ){
7207 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** ERROR: list syntax error '%s'\n",str+ipos) ;
7208 free(subv) ; return NULL((void*)0) ;
7209 }
7210 ipos += nused ;
7211 }
7212
7213 while( isspace((int) str[ipos])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) (((int) str[ipos]))] & (unsigned
short int) _ISspace) ) ipos++ ; /* skip blanks */
7214
7215 /**- if that's it for this sub-selector, add one value to list */
7216
7217 if( str[ipos] == ',' || ISEND(str[ipos])( (str[ipos])==']' || (str[ipos])=='}' || (str[ipos])=='\0' ) ){
7218 nout++ ;
7219 subv = (int *)realloc( (char *)subv , sizeof(int) * (nout+1) ) ;
7220 if( !subv ) {
7221 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** nifti_get_intlist: failed realloc of %d ints\n",
7222 nout+1);
7223 return NULL((void*)0);
7224 }
7225 subv[0] = nout ;
7226 subv[nout] = ibot ;
7227 if( ISEND(str[ipos])( (str[ipos])==']' || (str[ipos])=='}' || (str[ipos])=='\0' ) ) break ; /* done */
7228 ipos++ ; continue ; /* re-start loop at next sub-selector */
7229 }
7230
7231 /**- otherwise, must have '..' or '-' as next inputs */
7232
7233 if( str[ipos] == '-' ){
7234 ipos++ ;
7235 } else if( str[ipos] == '.' && str[ipos+1] == '.' ){
7236 ipos++ ; ipos++ ;
7237 } else {
7238 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** ERROR: index list syntax is bad: '%s'\n",
7239 str+ipos) ;
7240 free(subv) ; return NULL((void*)0) ;
7241 }
7242
7243 /**- get ending value for loop now */
7244
7245 if( str[ipos] == '$' ){ /* special case */
7246 itop = nvals-1 ; ipos++ ;
7247 } else { /* decode an integer */
7248 itop = strtol( str+ipos , &cpt , 10 ) ;
7249 if( itop < 0 ){
7250 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** ERROR: index %d is out of range 0..%d\n",
7251 itop,nvals-1) ;
7252 free(subv) ; return NULL((void*)0) ;
7253 }
7254 if( itop >= nvals ){
7255 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** ERROR: index %d is out of range 0..%d\n",
7256 itop,nvals-1) ;
7257 free(subv) ; return NULL((void*)0) ;
7258 }
7259 nused = (cpt-(str+ipos)) ;
7260 if( itop == 0 && nused == 0 ){
7261 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** ERROR: index list syntax error '%s'\n",str+ipos) ;
7262 free(subv) ; return NULL((void*)0) ;
7263 }
7264 ipos += nused ;
7265 }
7266
7267 /**- set default loop step */
7268
7269 istep = (ibot <= itop) ? 1 : -1 ;
7270
7271 while( isspace((int) str[ipos])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) (((int) str[ipos]))] & (unsigned
short int) _ISspace) ) ipos++ ; /* skip blanks */
7272
7273 /**- check if we have a non-default loop step */
7274
7275 if( str[ipos] == '(' ){ /* decode an integer */
7276 ipos++ ;
7277 istep = strtol( str+ipos , &cpt , 10 ) ;
7278 if( istep == 0 ){
7279 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** ERROR: index loop step is 0!\n") ;
7280 free(subv) ; return NULL((void*)0) ;
7281 }
7282 nused = (cpt-(str+ipos)) ;
7283 ipos += nused ;
7284 if( str[ipos] == ')' ) ipos++ ;
7285 if( (ibot-itop)*istep > 0 ){
7286 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** WARNING: index list '%d..%d(%d)' means nothing\n",
7287 ibot,itop,istep ) ;
7288 }
7289 }
7290
7291 /**- add values to output */
7292
7293 for( ii=ibot ; (ii-itop)*istep <= 0 ; ii += istep ){
7294 nout++ ;
7295 subv = (int *)realloc( (char *)subv , sizeof(int) * (nout+1) ) ;
7296 if( !subv ) {
7297 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** nifti_get_intlist: failed realloc of %d ints\n",
7298 nout+1);
7299 return NULL((void*)0);
7300 }
7301 subv[0] = nout ;
7302 subv[nout] = ii ;
7303 }
7304
7305 /**- check if we have a comma to skip over */
7306
7307 while( isspace((int) str[ipos])((*__ctype_b_loc ())[(int) (((int) str[ipos]))] & (unsigned
short int) _ISspace) ) ipos++ ; /* skip blanks */
7308 if( str[ipos] == ',' ) ipos++ ; /* skip commas */
7309
7310 } /* end of loop through selector string */
7311
7312 if( g_opts.debug > 1 ) {
7313 fprintf(stderrstderr,"+d int_list (vals = %d): ", subv[0]);
7314 for( ii = 1; ii <= subv[0]; ii++ ) fprintf(stderrstderr,"%d ", subv[ii]);
7315 fputc('\n',stderrstderr);
7316 }
7317
7318 if( subv[0] == 0 ){ free(subv); subv = NULL((void*)0); }
7319 return subv ;
7320}
7321
7322/*---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7323/*! Given a NIFTI_TYPE string, such as "NIFTI_TYPE_INT16", return the
7324 * corresponding integral type code. The type code is the macro
7325 * value defined in nifti1.h.
7326*//*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7327int nifti_datatype_from_string( const char * name )
7328{
7329 int tablen = sizeof(nifti_type_list)/sizeof(nifti_type_ele);
7330 int c;
7331
7332 if( !name ) return DT_UNKNOWN0;
7333
7334 for( c = tablen-1; c > 0; c-- )
7335 if( !strcmp(name, nifti_type_list[c].name) )
7336 break;
7337
7338 return nifti_type_list[c].type;
7339}
7340
7341
7342/*---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7343/*! Given a NIFTI_TYPE value, such as NIFTI_TYPE_INT16, return the
7344 * corresponding macro label as a string. The dtype code is the
7345 * macro value defined in nifti1.h.
7346*//*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7347char * nifti_datatype_to_string( int dtype )
7348{
7349 int tablen = sizeof(nifti_type_list)/sizeof(nifti_type_ele);
7350 int c;
7351
7352 for( c = tablen-1; c > 0; c-- )
7353 if( nifti_type_list[c].type == dtype )
7354 break;
7355
7356 return nifti_type_list[c].name;
7357}
7358
7359
7360/*---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7361/*! Determine whether dtype is a valid NIFTI_TYPE.
7362 *
7363 * DT_UNKNOWN is considered invalid
7364 *
7365 * The only difference 'for_nifti' makes is that DT_BINARY
7366 * should be invalid for a NIfTI dataset.
7367*//*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7368int nifti_datatype_is_valid( int dtype, int for_nifti )
7369{
7370 int tablen = sizeof(nifti_type_list)/sizeof(nifti_type_ele);
7371 int c;
7372
7373 /* special case */
7374 if( for_nifti && dtype == DT_BINARY1 ) return 0;
7375
7376 for( c = tablen-1; c > 0; c-- )
7377 if( nifti_type_list[c].type == dtype )
7378 return 1;
7379
7380 return 0;
7381}
7382
7383
7384/*---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7385/*! Only as a test, verify that the new nifti_type_list table matches
7386 * the the usage of nifti_datatype_sizes (which could be changed to
7387 * use the table, if there were interest).
7388 *
7389 * return the number of errors (so 0 is success, as usual)
7390*//*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7391int nifti_test_datatype_sizes(int verb)
7392{
7393 int tablen = sizeof(nifti_type_list)/sizeof(nifti_type_ele);
7394 int nbyper, ssize;
7395 int c, errs = 0;
7396
7397 for( c = 0; c < tablen; c++ )
7398 {
7399 nbyper = ssize = -1;
7400 nifti_datatype_sizes(nifti_type_list[c].type, &nbyper, &ssize);
7401 if( nbyper < 0 || ssize < 0 ||
7402 nbyper != nifti_type_list[c].nbyper ||
7403 ssize != nifti_type_list[c].swapsize )
7404 {
7405 if( verb || g_opts.debug > 2 )
7406 fprintf(stderrstderr, "** type mismatch: %s, %d, %d, %d : %d, %d\n",
7407 nifti_type_list[c].name, nifti_type_list[c].type,
7408 nifti_type_list[c].nbyper, nifti_type_list[c].swapsize,
7409 nbyper, ssize);
7410 errs++;
7411 }
7412 }
7413
7414 if( errs )
7415 fprintf(stderrstderr,"** nifti_test_datatype_sizes: found %d errors\n",errs);
7416 else if( verb || g_opts.debug > 1 )
7417 fprintf(stderrstderr,"-- nifti_test_datatype_sizes: all OK\n");
7418
7419 return errs;
7420}
7421
7422
7423/*---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7424/*! Display the nifti_type_list table.
7425 *
7426 * if which == 1 : display DT_*
7427 * if which == 2 : display NIFTI_TYPE*
7428 * else : display all
7429*//*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
7430int nifti_disp_type_list( int which )
7431{
7432 char * style;
7433 int tablen = sizeof(nifti_type_list)/sizeof(nifti_type_ele);
7434 int lwhich, c;
7435
7436 if ( which == 1 ){ lwhich = 1; style = "DT_"; }
7437 else if( which == 2 ){ lwhich = 2; style = "NIFTI_TYPE_"; }
7438 else { lwhich = 3; style = "ALL"; }
7439
7440 printf("nifti_type_list entries (%s) :\n"
7441 " name type nbyper swapsize\n"
7442 " --------------------- ---- ------ --------\n", style);
7443
7444 for( c = 0; c < tablen; c++ )
7445 if( (lwhich & 1 && nifti_type_list[c].name[0] == 'D') ||
7446 (lwhich & 2 && nifti_type_list[c].name[0] == 'N') )
7447 printf(" %-22s %5d %3d %5d\n",
7448 nifti_type_list[c].name,
7449 nifti_type_list[c].type,
7450 nifti_type_list[c].nbyper,
7451 nifti_type_list[c].swapsize);
7452
7453 return 0;
7454}
7455
7456
